revision.text:
{{Infobox actor |image=Joseph_Gordon-Levitt_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=Joseph Gordon-Levitt |birthname=Joseph Leonard Gordon-Levitt |born=February 17, 1981 |died= |nationality=American |gender=Male |eye=Brown |hair=Black |height= |website=[http://josephgordonlevitt.org/ Fan Site] |yearsactive=1988-present |inceptionrole=[[Arthur]] |academyawards= }} '''Joseph Leonard Gordon-Levitt''' (born February 17, 1981) is an American actor, known for the roles he has played as both a child and adult actor. His career has spanned more than 20 years, during which time he has worked in at least 24 feature films, as well as a number of television shows and theater productions.
Beginning in commercials as a young child, he went on to appear in a number of television films and series, including a lead role in a television revival of Dark Shadows and a film debut in 1992's Beethoven. An appearance in A River Runs Through It followed, along with a starring role in the 1994 movie Angels in the Outfield, as Roger Bomman. Gordon-Levitt subsequently co-starred in the television sitcom 3rd Rock from the Sun, as the young Tommy Solomon, and had a major supporting role in the 1999 film 10 Things I Hate About You.
After a hiatus during which he attended Columbia University, Gordon-Levitt abandoned television but returned to film acting as an adult, appearing in myriad independent films, beginning with the 2001 film Manic. Critically acclaimed roles in 2004's Mysterious Skin and 2006's Brick led to his being described as "one of the most interesting leading men in independent film, a thoughtful performer, simultaneously outspoken and introverted, who specializes in playing troubled characters at war with themselves and the world." In 2009, he starred as Tom Hansen in the well-reviewed comedy (500) Days of Summer.
He portrays [[Arthur]] in [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]].
==External Links==
Joseph Leonard Gordon-Levitt at the [http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0330687/ IMDB] [[Category:Actors]] [[Category:Production]]
[[es:Joseph Gordon-Levitt]]

{{Infobox actor |image=Ellen_Page_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=Ellen Page |birthname=Ellen Philpotts-Page |born=February 21, 1987 |died= |nationality=Canadian |gender=Female |eye=Brown |hair=Brown |height= |website=[http://ellenpage.org/ Fan Site] |yearsactive=1997–present |inceptionrole=[[Ariadne]] |academyawards= Nomination: Academy Award for Best Actress (2007) }} '''Ellen Philpotts-Page''' (born February 21, 1987), known professionally as '''Ellen Page''', is a Canadian actress. Page received both Golden Globe and Academy Award nominations for Best Actress for her role as the title character in the film Juno.
She is also known for her starring roles in ''Hard Candy'','' Juno,'' ''Smart People'', ''Whip It'', and as Katherine "Kitty" Pryde in ''X-Men: The Last Stand''. In addition, Page received attention in Canada for award-winning roles in ''Pit Pony'' and ''Marion Bridge'', as well as television shows ''Trailer Park Boys'' and ''ReGenesis''.
In 2008, Page was nominated for Time's 100 Most Influential People list and placed #86 on FHM's Sexiest Women in the World list. In June 2008, Page was named on Entertainment Weekly's future A-List stars list.
She portrays [[Ariadne]] in [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]].
==Biography== Ellen Philpotts-Page was born on February 21, 1987, in Halifax, Nova Scotia to Dennis Page and Martha Phillpotts. She wanted to start acting at an early age and attended the Neptune Theater School. After attending three different high schools, she graduated from the Shambhala School in Halifax. Her first appearance was in the TV show "Pit Pony," for which she received a Young Artist and Gemini nomination for Best Performance. After filming the movie Marion Bridge (2002), she realized that acting is what she wanted to do for the rest of her life. Ellen won the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor Award (from the Atlantic Film Festival) and another nomination for Wilby Wonderful. For the TV series ReGenesis, Page was given a Gemini for Best Performance.
==Trivia==
*Had to wear hair extensions for X-Men: The Last Stand (2006) as she had shaved her head bald for her role in Mouth to Mouth (2005).
*Considers herself to be a feminist and tries to steer clear of the "stereotypical roles for teenage girls" because she finds them to be "sexist".
*She originally turned down the role of Kitty Pryde in X-Men: The Last Stand (2006) until director Brett Ratner personally contacted her and talked her into it.
*As of 2010 she is the fourth youngest actress to receive a Best Actress in a Leading Role Academy Award nomination. She was at the age of 20 years and 335 days when she received a nomination for her performance in Juno (2007).
*She was ranked #8 on Entertainment Weekly's "30 Under 30" the actress list (2008), #10 on Moviefone's "The 25 Hottest Actors Under 25'" 92008), and #1 on interview magazines Hollywood faces to watch "future stars of tomorrow" along with Kellan Rhude.
*She was the first choice for Christine in Drag Me to Hell (2009), but was forced to pass due to scheduling difficulties, was in consideration for the part of Natalie Keener in Up in the Air (2009/I), and was originally cast in Jane Eyre (2010) as the title role, but quit the project when production was delayed.
[[es:Ellen Page]] [[Category:Actors]] [[Category:Production]] [[Category:Actors]] [[Category:Production]]

{{Infobox actor |image=Tom_Hardy_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=Tom Hardy |birthname=Edward Thomas Hardy |born=September 15, 1977 |died= |nationality=British |gender=Male |eye=Blue green |hair=Brown |height= |website=[http://www.tomhardy.org/ Fan Site] |yearsactive=2001–present |inceptionrole=[[Eames]] |academyawards= }} {{stub}} '''Edward Thomas "Tom" Hardy''' (born 15 September, 1977) is an English stage and screen actor, perhaps best known for his role as Praetor Shinzon in Star Trek Nemesis (2002) and the lead role in Bronson (2009). He portrays [[Eames]] in [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]].
[[es:Tom Hardy]] [[Category:Actors]] [[Category:Production]] [[Category:Stub]]

{{Infobox actor |image=Marion_Cotillard_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=Marion Cotillard |birthname= |born=September 30, 1975 |died= |nationality=French |gender=Female |eye=Blue |hair=Dark Brown |height= |website=[http://marion-cotillard.org/ Official Site] |yearsactive=1993–present |inceptionrole=[[Mallorie Cobb]] |academyawards=Best Performance by an Actress in a Leading Role (2007) }} '''Marion Cotillard''' (born 30 September 1975) is a French actress. She garnered critical acclaim for her roles in films such as ''My Sex Life... or How I Got Into an Argument'', ''Taxi'', ''Furia'' and ''Pretty Things''. She has also appeared in such films as ''Big Fish'', ''A Very Long Engagement'', for which she received a César Award for Best Supporting Actress; ''A Good Year'', ''Public Enemies'' and ''Nine''.
She won an Oscar for Best Actress, a BAFTA Best Actress's Award, a César for Best Actress and a Golden Globe for Best Actress in Musical or a Comedy for her portrayal of Édith Piaf in ''La Vie en Rose''. She made film history by becoming the first person to win an Academy Award for a French language performance. In 2010 she received a Golden Globe nomination for her performance in the musical ''Nine''.
She portrays [[Mallorie Cobb]] in ''[[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]]''.
On May 20, 2011 she gave birth to her son, Marcel. The father of her son is Guillaume Canet, who is Marion's boyfriend.
[[es:Marion Cotillard]]
==Trivia==
The musical cue for the [[kick]], is "Non, Je Ne Regrette Rien" by Edith Piaf, who was also portrayed by Marion Cotillard in ''Le Vie en Rose''. [[Category:Actors]] [[Category:Production]] [[Category:Citations needed]]
#REDIRECT [[Mallorie Cobb]] [[Category:Redirects]]

{{Infobox actor |image=Cillian_Murphy_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=Cillian Murphy |birthname= |born=May 25, 1976 |died= |nationality=Irish and English |gender=Male |eye=Blue |hair=Dark Brown |height= |website=[http://www.cilliansite.com/ Fan Site] |yearsactive=1996-present |inceptionrole=[[Robert Fischer]] |academyawards= }} '''Cillian Murphy''' (born 25 May 1976) is an Irish-born English film and theatre actor. He is often noted by critics for his chameleonic performances in diverse roles and distinctive blue eyes.
A native of Cork, Murphy began his performing career as a rock musician. After turning down a record deal, he made his professional acting debut in the play "''Disco Pigs,''" in 1996. He went on to star in Irish and UK film and stage productions throughout the late 1990s and early 2000s, first coming to international attention in 2003 as the hero in the post-apocalyptic film 28 Days Later. Murphy's best-known roles are as villains in two 2005 blockbusters: the Scarecrow in the superhero film Batman Begins, and Jackson Rippner in the thriller Red Eye. Next came two contrasting, widely acclaimed starring roles: his Golden Globe Award-nominated performance as transgender outcast "Kitten" in 2005's Breakfast on Pluto and a turn as a 1920s Irish revolutionary in the 2006 Palme d'Or winner, The Wind That Shakes the Barley. In 2010, Murphy will co-star in [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]], a big budget movie starring [[Leonardo DiCaprio]] by Batman Begins/The Dark Knight director [[Christopher Nolan]]. He portrays [[Robert Fischer]].
A resident of London since 2001, Murphy often works in or near the city and has expressed no desire to move to Hollywood. Uncomfortable on the celebrity circuit, he customarily gives interviews about his work, but does not appear on television talk shows or discuss details of his private life with the press.
[[File:Robert_Fischer.gif|thumb|Cillian Murphy as Robert Fischer]]
==Awards== * Best Actor Lead Film (2007) * European Film Festival Palic - Best Actor (2006) * GQ UK Men of the Year Awards - Actor of the Year (2006) ==Award Nominations== * Irish Film & Television Awards - Best Actor in a Feature Film (2003) * Irish Film & Television Awards - Best Actor in a Film, and Best Actor/Public Vote (2003) * MTV Movie Awards - Breakthrough Male Performance (2004) * Best Supporting Actor in a Feature Film (2005) * Best Irish Actor in a Feature Film (2005) * Saturn Awards - Best Supporting Actor (2006) * MTV Movie Awards - Best Villain (2006) * European Film Awards - European Actor of the Year (2006) * British Independent Film Awards - Best Actor (2006) * British Independent Film Awards - Best Actor (2007) * Irish Film & Television Awards - Best Actor Lead Film (2007), * Irish Film & Television Awards - Actor in a Lead Role in a Feature Film (2008) * British Independent Film Awards - Best Actor (2008) [[Category:Actors]] [[Category:Production]] [[Category:Article stubs]]

{{Infobox actor |image=Leonardo_DiCaprio_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=Leonardo DiCaprio |birthname=Leonardo Wilhelm DiCaprio |born=November 11, 1974 |died= |nationality=American |gender=Male |eye=Blue |hair=Brown |height= |website=[http://www.leonardodicaprio.com/ Official Website] |yearsactive=1989-present |inceptionrole=[[Dominic Cobb|Dom Cobb]] |academyawards= }}
'''Leonardo Wilhelm DiCaprio''' (born November 11, 1974) is an American actor and film producer. He plays the role of [[Dominic Cobb|Dom Cobb]] in the film [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]], and has been nominated for several Academy Awards for his past performances.
[[File:The_Extractor.gif|thumb|DiCaprio as Dom Cobb in a promotional picture]]
==Other Awards== Leonardo, over his career as an actor and producer, has won many awards ranging from the prestigious Golden Globe award to the not so prestigious Razzie Award.
Below is an extensive chronological list of the awards he has won in his lifetime. A list of the awards or prizes he has been ''nominated'' for is underneath this list.
* Chicago Film Critics Association Award for Emerging Actor (1993) * National Board of Review Award for Best Supporting Actor (1993) * Los Angeles Film Critics Association Awards - New Generation Award (1993) * Blockbuster Entertainment Award for Favorite Actor - Romance Category (1996) * Silver Bear for Best Actor (1996) * Chlotrudis Award for Best Supporting Actor (1996) * Blockbuster Entertainment Award for Favorite Actor - Drama Category (1997) * MTV Movie Award for Best Performance (1997) * Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Liar (2002) * Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Motion Picture Drama (2004) * MTV Movie Award for Best Performance (2004) * Hollywood Film Festival - Actor of the Year (2004) * Austin Film Critics Association Award for Best Actor (2006) * Irish Film and Television Audience Award for Best International Actor (2006) * National Board of Review Award for Best Cast (2006) * Satellite Award for Best Supporting Actor (2006) * Palm Springs International Film Festival Award for Best Ensemble Performance (2008)
==Award Nominations== Below is a chronological list of awards and prizes that Leonardo has been nominated for, but not won.
* Young Artist Award for Best Young Actor Starring in a Television Series (1990) * Young Artist Award for Best Young Actor in a Daytime Series (1990) * Young Artist Award for Best Young Actor Co-starring in a Television Series (1991-1992) * Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor (1993) * Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor – Motion Picture (1993) * MTV Movie Award for Best On-Screen Duo (1996) * MTV Movie Award for Best Kiss (1996) * MTV Movie Award for Best Performance (1996) * Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Cast - Motion Picture (1996) * Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Motion Picture Drama (1997) * MTV Movie Award for Best On-Screen Duo (1997) * MTV Movie Award for Best Kiss (1997) * Satellite Award for Best Actor - Motion Picture Drama (1997) * Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture (1997) * Teen Choice Award for Choice Hissy Fit — Film (1998) * Teen Choice Award for Choice Actor — Film (2000) * Teen Choice Award for Choice Chemistry (2000) * Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Motion Picture Drama (2002) * MTV Movie Award for Best Performance (2002) * MTV Movie Award for Best Kiss (2002) * Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Liplock (2002) * Academy Award for Best Actor (2004) * BAFTA Award for Best Actor in a Leading Role (2004) * Broadcast Film Critics Association Award for Best Actor (2004) * London Film Critics Circle Award for Best Actor (2004) * Online Film Critics Society Award for Best Actor (2004) * Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture (2004) * Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Leading Role (2004) * Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Actor — Drama (2004) * Visual Effects Society Award for Outstanding Performance by an Actor or Actress in a Visual Effects Film (2004) * Academy Award for Best Actor (2006) * Broadcast Film Critics Association Award for Best Actor (2006) * Central Ohio Film Critics Association Award for Actor of the Year (2006) (2x) * Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Motion Picture Drama (2006) * Satellite Award for Best Actor - Motion Picture Drama (2006) * Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Leading Role (2006) * Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Actor — Drama (2006) * BAFTA Award for Best Actor in a Leading Role (2006) * Broadcast Film Critics Association Award for Best Actor (2006) * Central Ohio Film Critics Association Award for Actor of the Year (2006) * Chicago Film Critics Association Award for Best Actor (2006) * Empire Award for Best Actor (2006) * Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Motion Picture Drama (2006) * Online Film Critics Society Award for Best Actor (2006) * People's Choice Award for Best On-Screen Match-Up (2006) * Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture (2006) * Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Supporting Role (2006) * Teen Choice Awards - Choice Movie Actor: Drama (2006) * Detroit Film Critics Society Award for Best Actor (2008) * Detroit Film Critics Society Award for Best Cast (2008) * Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Motion Picture Drama (2008) * Satellite Award for Best Actor - Motion Picture Drama (2008)

{{Infobox actor |image=Ken_Watanabe_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=Ken Watanabe |birthname=渡辺 謙 |born=October 21, 1959 |died= |nationality=Japanese |gender=Male |eye=Brown |hair=Black |height= |website= |yearsactive=1979—present |inceptionrole=[[Saito]] |academyawards=Nomination: Best Perfomance by an Actor in a Supporting Role (2004) }} '''Ken Watanabe''' (渡辺 謙, Watanabe Ken) (born October 21, 1959) is a Japanese stage, film, and television actor. To English-speaking audiences he is known for playing tragic hero characters, such as General Tadamichi Kuribayashi in Letters from Iwo Jima and Lord Katsumoto Moritsu in The Last Samurai, for which he was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor. Among other awards, he has won the Japan Academy Prize for Best Actor twice, in 2007 for Memories of Tomorrow and in 2010 for Shizumanu Taiyō. He is the father of actors Dai and Anne Watanabe from a previous marriage.
He portrays [[Saito]] in [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]].
==Awards== * Elandor Awards - Newcomer Award (1987) * Blue Ribbon Awards - Special Award (2004) * Television Drama Academy Awards (Winter) - Best Supporting Actor * Hochi Film Awards - Best Actor * Nikkan Sports Film Awards - Best Actor * Blue Ribbon Awards - Best Actor * Japan Academy Awards - Best Actor * Fujimoto Prize - Special Prize * Kinema Junpo Awards - Best Actor * Hochi Film Awards - Best Actor * Japan Academy Awards - Best Actor

{{Infobox actor |image=Tomberenger.jpg |imagesize=250px |name=Tom Berenger |birthname=Thomas Michael Moore |born=May 31, 1949 |died= |nationality=American |gender=Male |eye=Blue |hair=Brown |height= |website= |yearsactive=1968–present |inceptionrole=[[Peter Browning]] |academyawards= }} '''Tom Berenger''' (born May 31, 1949) is an American actor known mainly for his roles in action films. He portrays [[Peter Browning]] in [[Inception (2010 film)]]. [[Category:Actors]] [[Category:Production]]

{{Infobox actor |image=Dileep_Rao_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=Dileep Rao |birthname= |born= |died= |nationality=American |gender=Male |eye=Brown |hair=Black |height= |website= |yearsactive=2009-present |inceptionrole=[[Yusuf]] |academyawards= }} '''Dileep Rao '''plays [[Yusuf]], also know as The Chemist in [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]], and is an American actor who has appeared in feature films and television series. He starred in the 2009 horror movie Drag Me to Hell, and also has a role in the major blockbuster film "Avatar," where he portrays a character by the name of Max Patel.
He competed on "Jeopardy!" TV show on June 7th, 2002, winning $34,400. On June 8, 2008, Rao was randomly selected from over 1600 entrants to play the NPR Weekend Edition Sunday puzzle on air with Will Shortz. Rao claimed that he had been playing the puzzle at home for "infinity years." Before booking roles, he taught summer acting classes at the Marlborough school. He participated in the Master of Fine Arts program at the American Conservatory Theater; after the three-year program, he attained his MFA.
==External Links== *[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2438307/ Dileep Rao] at the Internet Movie Database. [[Category:Actors]] [[Category:Production]]

{{Infobox actor |image=petepostlethwaite.jpg |imagesize=250px |name=Pete Postlethwaite |birthname=Peter William Postlethwaite |born=February 16, 1946 |died=January 2, 2011 |nationality=British |gender=Male |eye= |hair=Brown |height=1.75 meters |website= |yearsactive=1975-2011 |inceptionrole=[[Maurice Fischer]] |academyawards= }} Peter William "Pete" Postlethwaite, OBE (pronounced /ˈpɒsəlθweɪt/; born 7 February 1945, † 2. January 2011) was an English actor. He portrayed [[Maurice Fischer]] in the movie [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]].
==Early life== Postlethwaite was born in Warrington, Cheshire, England, the fourth and youngest child of Mary Geraldine and William Postlethwaite. He trained as a teacher at [[wikipedia:St. Mary's University College (Twickenham)|St Mary's College]], [[wikipedia:Strawberry Hill, London|Strawberry Hill, London]] and taught drama before training as an actor at the Bristol Old Vic Theatre School. Postlethwaite was a veteran of the Royal Shakespeare Company and other acting troupes.
==Career== After routine early appearances in small parts for television programmes such as ''[[wikipedia:The Professionals (TV series)|The Professionals]]'', Postlethwaite's first success came with the film ''[[wikipedia:Distant Voices, Still Lives|Distant Voices, Still Lives]]'' in 1988. He received an [[wikipedia:Academy Award|Academy Award]] nomination for his role in ''[[wikipedia:In the Name of the Father (film)|In the Name of the Father]]'' in 1993. His performance as the mysterious lawyer "Kobayashi" in ''[[wikipedia:The Usual Suspects|The Usual Suspects]]'' is also well-known, and he later made appearances in several successful films, including ''[[wikipedia:Alien 3|Alien 3]]'', ''[[wikipedia:Amistad (film)|Amistad]]'', ''[[wikipedia:Brassed Off|Brassed Off]]'', ''[[wikipedia:The Shipping News (film)|The Shipping News]]'', ''[[wikipedia:The Constant Gardener (film)|The Constant Gardener]]'', and as Friar Lawrence in [[wikipedia:Baz Luhrmann|Baz Luhrmann]]'s ''[[wikipedia:Romeo + Juliet|Romeo + Juliet]]''.
In 2003, he was both the physical and vocal actor for the villain Deeth in ''[[wikipedia:Zixx|Zixx]]: Level One'', a Canadian TV series created by [[wikipedia:Starz Media|IDT Entertainment]]. The same year, he went to Australia, touring a 90-minute one-man play called ''Scaramouche Jones'' where he is a clown trying to find out why he is who he is before he dies at midnight.<ref>[http://www.abc.net.au/tv/enoughrope/transcripts/s879121.htm]</ref> Directed by Rupert Goold, who would also direct his [[wikipedia:King Lear|Lear]] in 2008, Postlethwaite played every character. As well as [[wikipedia:Australia|Australia]], the play toured [[wikipedia:Canada|Canada]], [[wikipedia:New Zealand|New Zealand]] and [[wikipedia:UK|Britain]] to great acclaim.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/stage/theatre/article5008655.ece | work=The Times | location=London | title=The Coronation of Pete Postlethwaite | first=Jane | last=Wheatley | date=2008-10-27 | accessdate=2010-05-22}}</ref>
In the 2004 book ''[[wikipedia:The Art of Discworld|The Art of Discworld]]'', [[wikipedia:Terry Pratchett|Terry Pratchett]] said that he had always imagined [[wikipedia:Sam Vimes|Sam Vimes]] as 'a younger, slightly bulkier version of Pete Postlethwaite'.<ref>Pratchett, Terry and Paul Kidby. ''The Art of Discworld'', Victor Gollancz Ltd, 2004 ISBN 0-575-07511-2</ref>
Steven Spielberg called Postlethwaite "the best actor in the world" after working with him on the ''The Lost World: Jurassic Park'', of which Postlethwaite says: I'm sure what Spielberg actually said was, "The thing about Pete is that he thinks he's the best actor in the world."
One of his more notable roles was as antagonist Sergeant Obadiah Hakeswill in ITV's ''Sharpe'' series, which starred Sean Bean. Postlethwaite has said that this was one of his favorite roles and that he and Sean played so well off each other because of their mutual love and respect for each other. Bernard Cornwell, the author and creator of the ''Sharpe'' series, specifically wrote Hakeswill's character in later novels to reflect Postlewaite's performance as the character in the TV series. Postlethwaite also co-starred with Sean Bean in ''When Saturday Comes''.
Postlethwaite next starred in the Liverpool stage production of ''King Lear'' in 2008 at the Everyman Theatre, Liverpool and at the Young Vic, London. He appears in the [[wikipedia:climate change|climate change]]-themed film ''The Age of Stupid'', premiered in March 2009. Having recently installed a wind turbine in his garden, he said was really impressed by the film.
==Awards== He was made an [[wikipedia:Order of the British Empire|OBE]] in the 2004 New Year's Honours List. At the premiere of The Age of Stupid on 15 March 2009, he promised the UK Energy and Climate Change minister [[wikipedia:Ed Miliband|Ed Miliband]] that he would return this medal if the government gave the go-ahead for new coal-fired units at Kingsnorth power station.
==Personal life== Postlethwaite lived in Shropshire, near Bishop's Castle, with his wife Jackie, a former BBC producer, whom he married in 2003 in Chichester, Sussex. They had two children, both of whom were born in Shropshire: William John (born 1989), a drama student at LAMDA, and daughter Lily Kathleen (born 1996).
==Death== Pete Postlethwaite died on 2 January, 2011 after suffering from pancreatic cancer.<ref>[http://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/news/actor-pete-postlethwaite-dies-age-64-2174887.html Actor Pete Postlethwaite dies age 64] ''The Independent'' (London) 3 January 2010</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Production]] [[Category:Actors]]

But in the Spanish wiki the English one does not appear.--[[User:Lord David|Lord David]] 14:55, September 13, 2010 (UTC) :::::::Thanks, I just did it!!!! You have helped much more than Wikia has, mate! The English links work, as well. Now, we're the same system but in two languages. That's so awesome! ''May the Force be with us!''--[[User:Lord David|Lord David]] 21:45, September 13, 2010 (UTC) ::Hi, I need your help again. You know, I have to prepare the 'spotlight' for the wiki, and I wanted it to be the Totem picture, but I don't know how to put the ''Inception'' title on it. I would like you helped me. Something like this: [[File:Spinning-top-inception.jpg|200px|center]] :::Of course, with the word "Inception" written on it, just the way you did those terrific headlines. I don't know how to, so I need help... ;)--[[User:Lord David|Lord David]] 05:32, September 14, 2010 (UTC) ::::Thank you. Seriously, I believe the spinning top is the most representative picture of the Inception world. Unfortunately, now it happens that the Spanish wiki needs at least 100 articles to have an spotlight :( Goddammit!--[[User:Lord David|Lord David]] 02:40, September 15, 2010 (UTC) == Monaco == Hi, Samsonius, Im back to ask something else. How do you make a monaco? Thanks.--[[User:Lord David|Lord David]] 02:51, September 17, 2010 (UTC) ==Very Interesting== Thought you might enjoy this: [http://thelastpsychiatrist.com/2010/07/inception_spoilers.html]. [[User:Acaeton|Acaeton]] 03:15, September 24, 2010 (UTC) == Kick == What exactly did I do wrong? This is what I added to the article: --- A kick is always performed on one's sleeping body, not one's body within a dream, except when Fischer and Ariadne were in limbo and the kick was clearly performed in the limbo stage. If a kick can only be performed on the sleeping body and not the body within a dream (i.e., it has to be performed on the level above), then why does Ariadne say (about Fischer who is in limbo), "We can give him his own KICK there" and "We need to give him a KICK here." Also, Ariadne does not jump off the building at just any moment (she could have done so, if she only wanted to kill herself), she jumps when Cobb says: "Ariadne! That's the kick! You have to go," so obviously, she wants to synchronize with the other kicks, not to kill herself in limbo. Plot hole? If not, why not? --- Where is the problem there? Me saying, "Plot hole?" If that's the only issue, why revert the entire thing instead of just removing that piece? Everything I said is correct. I'm not trying to start a fight but it seems that you guys are purposely ignoring valid information so that the movie seems like it has no mistakes. How can you accept the information of "A kick is always performed on one's sleeping body, not one's body within a dream" when that is clearly not the case, as we saw with Fischer and Ariadne? I'll edit it again to not ask "plot hole?" but please understand that my information is valid and should therefore be in the article. If you wish to refute my information, you should say, "There was an instance where it appeared that a kick had been performed in the same dream level as the kick, but..." or something like that, instead of just removing the information entirely. A kick had been performed on the body in the dream (Fischer and Ariadne), and that information should obviously be included since it is wrong to say that it was only performed a layer above the dream. == Question == Hi Azelius, sorry to bother you but I was wondering how did you create [http://inception.wikia.com/wiki/File:Samsoniussig.png this]? [[User:4th Hale|4th Hale]] 02:39, August 19, 2011 (UTC) :Oh, I just use Photoshop and wrote out my name in a font that I liked, used a radial gradient, and then put a drop shadow on the text. I rendered it without a background and then just coded a signature that linked the picture to my user page. I don't use that sig anymore though, since it clutters up the mainspace when you add a picture every time you comment on an article's or person's talk page. So now I just use a simple sig with the same type of gradient for nearly the same effect without the overly large eyesore. Cheers, {{Samsoniussig}} 06:26, August 19, 2011 (UTC) ::Ah thanks and one more question, how good are you in graphic design?--[[User:4th Hale|4th Hale]] [[User talk:4th Hale|(Talk)]] 00:04, August 21, 2011 (UTC) :::I have some experience with it, and I'm decent with graphic design. I designed and created the skins for a few wikis, including this one, and I've done a few other projects with 3D modeling, typography, and website layouts. So I'd say that I'm competent with graphic design and I'm always learning new techniques and ideas. {{Samsoniussig}} 00:12, August 21, 2011 (UTC) ::::They're very good, I was thinking if it's alright with you if you can create a wiki skin for the [http://brucelee.wikia.com/wiki/Bruce_Lee_Wiki Bruce Lee Wiki]? sorry if the message sounds a bit demanding.--[[User:4th Hale|4th Hale]] [[User talk:4th Hale|(Talk)]] 03:25, August 21, 2011 (UTC) ==A film as good as Inception== http://suckerpunch.wikia.com/wiki/Sucker_Punch_%28film%29

revision.text: == Licensing == {{None selected}}

{{Stub}} {{Infobox character |image=Peter_Browning.jpg |imagesize=250px |name=Peter Browning |born=68 years ago |died= |lives=United States of America |gender=Male |status=Alive |eye= |family= |occupation=Godfather and legal counsel |loyalties=*[[Maurice Fischer]] *[[Robert Fischer]] |portrayed=[[Tom Berenger]] |first=''[[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]]'' |last= }} '''Peter Browning''' is [[Robert Fischer]]'s godfather and [[Maurice Fischer|Maurice Fischer's]] longtime legal counsel. To Robert he is more of a surrogate father than a godfather, with Robert even going so far as to call him "Uncle Peter." He is portrayed by actor [[Tom Berenger]].
As Maurice's health declined and Robert displayed little interest in attending to [[Fischer Morrow|company]] matters, Browning's power grew. He got strong authority in the company, even going against Maurice's previous prerogative of avoiding legal action wherever possible, and struggled to have Robert discuss power of attoney. While his personal desires are unclear, he has great affection for Robert, being described as the one positive relationship the young man has.
[[File:Tom-berenger-inception.jpg|left|thumb]][[Eames]] used the close ties Browning has to the elder and younger Fischer as part of the team’s inception plan. In the first level, [[The City (dream)|The City]], Eames [[Forging|adopted]] Browning’s appearance and mannerisms in order to claim that the team that kidnapped Fischer also kidnapped and tortured him. Eames used this to enquire into Fischer’s relationship with his father and to implant the idea of his father having a second will, which would split up the company if released. Thus, Browning was used as a trusted guide to set the original idea into Fisher’s mind.
In the [[The Hotel (dream)|second dream level]], the team used Fischer’s [[projection]] of Browning (who appear slightly more arrogant then in reality) to their advantage. Once the projection was captured by the team, they encouraged Fisher to believe that Browning arranged his kidnapping. Once Fischer believed them, the projection conformed to Fischer’s new perspective of him and admitted doing so. He claimed the will was Maurice’s attempt to taunt Robert for not being worthy of his accomplishments, while this was a combination of the idea’s Eames planted and Fischer’s own perception of his father.
The main reason for this was to have Fischer transfer his resentment of his father to Browning, thus repairing his view of his father and allowing him to attain emotional renewal. After Fischer wakes up, he may feel suspicion and resentment toward Browning, but will not be consciously aware why. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Stub]]

{{Stub}} {{Infobox character |image= Yusuf_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=Yusuf |born=40 years ago |died= |lives=Mombasa, Kenya, Africa |gender=Male |status=Alive |eye=Brown |family=Unknown |occupation=Chemist |loyalties=*[[Saito|The Tourist]] *[[Dominic Cobb|Dom Cobb]] *[[The Team]] |portrayed=[[Dileep Rao]] |first=''[[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]]'' |last= }}
{{Quote|'''Oh, ha bloody ha!'''}}
'''Yusuf''' is the [[The Team|team member]] who formulates the drugs, including his own brand of [[Somnacin]], needed to enter the [[The Dreams|dream world]]. To allow the dreamers to enter the multi-level dream of the [[The Fischer Inception Job|Fischer Inception Job]] he combines his drugs with a powerful sedative that keeps them "under", while still keeping the dream worlds somewhat stable. Only a [[Kick|falling sensation]] is able to wake the dreamers from the dream state while under the influence of these drugs. He is portrayed by actor [[Dileep Rao]]. He uses a two-toned SIG Sauer P232 in a attempt to eliminate the one [[projection]] that got onto the bridge in the [[The City (dream)|first level]] of the Fischer Inception Job. ==Development== [[File:Tumblr_l95g0fRxkm1qd8j5mo1_400.jpg|thumb|left|200px|The Chemist Fan-Made Poster]] Dileep Rao describes Yusuf as ''“an avant-garde pharmacologist, who is a resource for people, like Cobb, who want to do this work unsupervised, unregistered and unapproved of by anyone. Yusuf obviously has a monetary interest in helping Cobb, but he is also motivated by a burning curiosity. He has been experimenting with this stuff for so long and now he wants to see what it’s like.''”
“''The role of the chemist was particularly tough because you don’t want him to seem like some kind of drug dealer. He’s absolutely not'',” says co-producer Jordan Goldberg. “''He’s someone who is committed to the art of dream sharing and making it work in ways it hasn’t before. We needed Yusuf to be funny and interesting and obviously smart, and Dileep is all of those things.''” ==Personality== Yusuf is a master of his craft, and as such, maintains a cool and collected attitude when within his own comfort zone. However, of the team, he is one of the least experienced in the practice of [[Dream-Sharing|shared dreaming]], and by extension, in the practice of extraction and inception. As such, he makes many rookie mistakes, such as forgetting to go to the bathroom before going to sleep and forgetting, for a moment during the car chase, that the rest of the team was asleep. ==Abilities== [[File:Basement_dreaming.jpg|thumb]] Yusuf is an extremely talented scientist in his field. His ability to concoct powerful and creatively useful sedatives is beyond compare. As a chemist, his talents lie mainly in the theory of dream-sharing, and his talents within the dream world are extremely limited, as evidenced by his poor driving under pressure. ==Quotes== *Arthur: "''And you. You knew about this and went along with it.''"
Yusuf: "''I trusted him! (referring to Dom Cobb)''"
Arthur: "''You trusted him. What, when he promised you half of his share?''"
Yusuf: "''No... his whole share.''" ==Trivia== *He was known as The Chemist in some promotional material. [[es:Yusuf]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Stub]] [[Category:The Team]]
[[Category:User Banner and Images]]

{{Infobox company |logo=Warner Bros TCW.jpg |logosize=250px |name=Warner Bros. Pictures Logo |type=Subsidiary of Time Warner |industry=Entertainment |founded=Hollywood, California, USA
(1977/1983) |headquarters=Burbank, Wichita Falls, USA |area=Worldwide |keypeople=Barry Meyer, Chairman and CEO
Alan F. Horn, President and COO
Edward A. Romano EVP and CFO |products=Motion pictures, television programs |revenue=$11.7 billion US$ (2001) |income=$845 million US$ (2006) |owner=Time Warner |parent=Time Warner |website=[http://www.warnerbros.com/ www.warnerbros.com]}} '''Warner Bros. Entertainment, Inc.''', also known as '''Warner Bros. Pictures''' or simply '''Warner Bros.''' is an American producer of film and television entertainment. One of the major film studios, it is a subsidiary of Time Warner, with its headquarters in Hollywood, California and New York City. Warner Bros. coproduced [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]] along with [[Legendary Pictures]] and [[Syncopy Films]]. [[Category:Production]] [[Category:Company]]

{{Stub}} {{Infobox character |image=Miles_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=Stephen Miles |born= |died= |lives=Paris, France |gender=Male |status=Alive |eye=Blue |family=*[[Mallorie Cobb]] (daughter) *[[Dominick Cobb]] (son-in-law) *[[James Cobb]] (grandson) *[[Phillipa Cobb]] (granddaughter) *[[Marie]] (ex-wife) |occupation=*Mentor to Cobb *College architecture professor |loyalties=Dom Cobb |portrayed=[[Michael Caine]] |first=''[[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]]'' |last= }} '''Stephen Miles''' is [[Mallorie Cobb]]'s father and [[Dominick Cobb]]'s father-in-law. He is kind and caring, and acts as a mentor to Cobb in the face of Mal's death and Cobb's subsequent months on the run from the law. He is also [[Ariadne]]'s college professor. He is portrayed by actor [[Michael Caine]].
When Dom finds himself in need of a new architect, he appeals to Miles, his mentor and former teacher. Miles acts as an intermediary between Dom and his children, [[James Cobb|James]] and [[Phillipa Cobb|Phillipa]], bringing them gifts from their father, though he expresses to Dom that gifts alone will not maintain his relationship with his children. He disapproves of Dom using [[Dream-Sharing]] for illegal [[extraction]]s, which Dom justifies as the only means he has to find a way back to his children. Despite his reluctance, he gives into Dom's request for one of Miles' students to work as an architect for the [[The Fischer Inception Job|Inception]] job; Miles suggests [[Ariadne]] for the job.
Following Dom's arrival in Los Angeles, Miles greets him at the airport and brings him back to his house, where Phillipa and James are waiting.
==Quotes== <!-- We want 5 or 6 quotes. That is the maximum, anymore are likely to be removed. If you wish to add a quote and believe your quote is better than the ones we already have you can replace one of them. --> *"''Come back to reality, Dom.''"

revision.text: Hey guys, I know most of you from the Avatar Wiki and just realized this wiki was under construction. I'm really looking forward to this movie, and want to help out in any way I can. I was just wondering where you guys were getting your information. Obviously you haven't seen the movie yet (right?), but if you've seen the '''correct''' script (as I've seen a fake or two floating around) can you let me know? [[Category:Blog posts]]

revision.comment: Created page with 'That's great to hear, Tecto. I'm hoping you can help with infoboxes, since I'm absolutely horrible at understanding the actor one. I got the character one down after intense gues…'
revision.text: That's great to hear, Tecto. I'm hoping you can help with infoboxes, since I'm absolutely horrible at understanding the actor one. I got the character one down after intense guess and check, so I'm proud of myself for that one. :P We're mainly getting our information either from Wikipedia and other assorted sites for the actor info, and looking at either IMDb or The Film Stage for information on the actual characters and plot. Haven't seen the movie yet, although my friends and I purchased tickets to go see it on opening day in IMAX, so we should have some real concrete info pretty soon. I haven't seen a scriptment around either, but I noticed on Wikipedia that Nolan wrote an 80 page essay on dream-stealing, so if we can get our hands on that, we should be able to write some good articles. It's great to have you here, and I'm sure you'll be one of our greatest assets on the wiki.

{{Quote|'''Just a sec guys, I gotta go give some Tender Llama Caresses.'''}} {{Infobox character |image = Myuserpage.png |imagesize = 250px |name = Matias |born = October 6, 1994 |lives = [[Limbo]] |gender = Male |status = Alive (I hope) |eye = |family = Unkown |occupation = *Bureaucrat *Wiki co-founder |loyalties = *[[Inception Wiki]]
(Bureaucrat) *[http://james-camerons-avatar.wikia.com/wiki/Avatar_Wiki James Cameron's Avatar Wiki]
(Creator) |portrayed = Matias Arana |first = }} ==(((((About Me)))))== As the co-creator, [[Inception Wiki:Bureaucrats|bureaucrat]] and administrator of the wiki, my main goal is to keep the community happy and the layout clean. If you have any complaints or questions feel free to leave a message on my [[User_talk:Matias_arana_10|talk page]]. You can also sometimes catch me on the [http://james-camerons-avatar.wikia.com/wiki/Avatar_Wiki:IRC IRC Channel]. ==(((((Funny Links)))))== When editing, you come across some funny edits, like this ones: ''(This section is currently in progress)'' *[http://james-camerons-avatar.wikia.com/index.php?title=Mating&diff=64585&oldid=59352 This] should be a real category. *Badges can lead to [http://james-camerons-avatar.wikia.com/index.php?title=User_talk%3ADanthaMan8&diff=62995&oldid=45016 stupid edits]. *Why do people ask [http://answers.wikia.com/index.php?title=Why_did_God_make_women_so_sexy&action=history stupid] questions? *Avatar fans [http://james-camerons-avatar.answers.wikia.com/wiki/Special:Search?search=mating&go=1&x=0&y=0 love] Na'vi sex. About 50 questions there =P *[http://james-camerons-avatar.wikia.com/index.php?title=User_talk%3AMatias_arana_10&diff=63859&oldid=63796 Um...] no idea. ==(((((My Current Projects)))))== As the creator of the wiki, this is my main project right now, so you can find me almost every day around. If you have any question about anything, ask me in my [[User_talk:Matias_arana_10|talk page]]. My main goals: *Keep the wiki clean of vandals. *Source all the information on the wiki. *Try to help all the users I can. *Help with templates. ==(((((Wikis)))))== {| class=wikitable |http://images2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20100707154231/jamescameronsavatar/images/b/bc/Wiki.png |http://images1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20100708222041/inception/images/b/bc/Wiki.png |http://images4.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20090711174535/thementalist/images/b/bc/Wiki.png |- |'''B'crat''': [[w:c:james-camerons-avatar|Avatar Wiki]] |'''B'crat''': [[w:c:inception|Inception Wiki]] |'''Sysop''': [[w:c:thementalist|The Mentalist Wiki]] |- |http://images3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20100601091619/shrek/images/b/bc/Wiki.png |http://images1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20100426073710/avatar/images/7/73/Mainpage-logo-transparent.png |http://images3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20100724165711/prisonbreak/images/b/bc/Wiki.png |- |'''B'crat''': [[w:c:shrek|Shrek Wiki]] |Edited: [[w:c:avatar|The Last Airbender Wiki]] |'''B'crat''': [[w:c:prisonbreak|Prison Break Wiki]] |- |http://images4.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20091116213521/assassinscreed/images/b/bc/Wiki.png |http://images4.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20100701005350/american-idol/images/b/bc/Wiki.png |http://images3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20091217124450/harrypotter/images/b/bc/Wiki.png |  |- |Edited: [[w:c:assassinscreed|The Assassin's Creed Wiki]] |'''B'crat''': [[w:c:americanidol|American Idol Wiki]] |Edited: [[w:c:harrypotter|Harry Potter Wiki]] |- |http://images3.wikia.nocookie.net/fringe/images/b/bc/Wiki.png |http://images3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20100120210353/battleangel/images/6/67/WIki.png |http://images3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20100803051033/mountainsofmadness/images/b/bc/Wiki.png |- |Edited: [[w:c:fringe|FringeWiki]] |'''Sysop''': [[w:c:battleangel|Battle Angel Alita Wiki]] |'''B'crat''': [[w:c:moutainsofmadness|Mountains of Madness Wiki]] |} __NOTOC__

{{Infobox actor |image=Wallypfister.jpg |imagesize=250px |name=Wally Pfister |birthname=Walter Pfister |born=July 8, 1961 |died= |nationality=American |gender=Male |eye= |hair= |height= |website= |yearsactive=1988–present |inceptionrole=Cinematographer |academyawards= }}
'''Walter Pfister''', A.S.C. (born July 8, 1961), better known as Wally Pfister, is an Academy Award nominated American cinematographer, who is best known for his work on [[Christopher Nolan|Christopher Nolan's]] films, including ''Memento'', ''Insomnia'', ''Batman Begins'', ''The Prestige'', ''The Dark Knight'' and ''[[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]]''. Pfister is also known for his work on director F. Gary Gray's ''The Italian Job''. [[Category:Production]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox album |name = ''Inception: Music from the Motion Picture'' |image = File:Inception_OST_Front_Cover.png |image_caption = Front Cover |image_back = |image_back_caption = |image_inside = |image_inside_caption = |image_inlay = |image_inlay_caption = |image_disc = |image_disc_caption = |artist = [[Hans Zimmer]]
[[Johnny Marr]] |producer = |label = Reprise Records |released = July 13, 2010 |genre = Soundtrack |media_type = Audio CD, MP3 |disc_num = 1 |tracks = 12 |length = 49:20 |asin = |asin_raw = |ean = |ean_raw = |oclc = |oclc_raw = |size = |weight = }} '''''Inception: Music from the Motion Picture''''' is the soundtrack from the movie ''[[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]]''. Composer [[Hans Zimmer]] worked with director [[Christopher Nolan]] to score the film, marking their third collaboration. According to Zimmer, the music is "a very electronic score." Surprisingly, Nolan demanded that Zimmer base the score on his feelings and their conversations rather than fitting the music to the film-- Zimmer wasn't permitted to see the movie until after the soundtrack was finished[http://www.popmatters.com/pm/feature/128323-we-built-our-own-world-hans-zimmer-and-the-music-of-inception/ We Built Our Own World: Hans Zimmer and the Music of Inception]. Zimmer brought guitarist [[Johnny Marr]] in to collaborate with him throughout the score, and the two debuted 20 minutes of the score with a 20-piece orchestra at the July 13 Inception premiere before a live audience and over the Internet[http://hans-zimmer.com/fr/newsite.php?rub=detail&id=927 Inception Soundtrack Hans Zimmer (2010)]. An album containing some of Zimmer's music for the film was released on Tuesday, July 13. ==Hidden Layers== Much like the story of the movie, the soundtrack itself is layered. Zimmer employs [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non,_je_ne_regrette_rien "Non, je ne regrette rien"] by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%89dith_Piaf Édith Piaf] as a leitmotif, both in its usual form, and through heavily manipulated use of the opening bars. When slowed down by a significant factor, these bars take on a pulsating purcussive aspect, which underpin much of Zimmer's original elements. A popular YouTube video[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UVkQ0C4qDvM YouTube - Inception Music Comparison] audibly compares the central theme with the original song. ==Tracks== # "''[[Half Remembered Dream]]''" (Length - 1:12) # "''[[We Built Our Own World]]''" (Length - 1:55) # "''[[Dream Is Collapsing]]''" (Length - 2:28) # "''[[Radical Notion]]''" (Length - 3:43) # "''[[Old Souls]]''" (Length - 7:44) # "''[[528491 (music)|528491]]''" (Length - 2:23) # "''[[Mombasa (music)|Mombasa]]''" (Length - 4:54) # "''[[One Simple Idea]]''" (Length - 2:28) # "''[[Dream Within A Dream]]''" (Length - 5:04) # "''[[Waiting For A Train]]''" (Length - 9:03) # "''[[Paradox]]'" (Length - 3:25)'' # "''[[Time]]''" (Length - 4:35) Two exclusive bonus tracks, "''[[Projections (music)|Projections]]''" (Length - 7:04) and "''[[Don't Think About Elephants]]''" (Length - 5:36) became available through the official [http://www.inceptionscore.com/ score website] as of August 12, requiring an e-mail address to obtain the tracks. ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Inception]] [[Category:Music|*]] [[Category:Stub]] [[Category:Merchandise]] [[Category:Citations needed]] [[es:Inception: Music from the Motion Picture]]

revision.comment: moved [[User blog:Matias arana 10/Reviews of Inception]] to [[User blog:Matias Arana/Reviews of Inception]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Matias arana 10|Matias arana 10]]" to "[[User:Matias Arana|Matias Arana]]"
revision.text:
The first reviews of [[Inception (2010 film)]] have been extremely postive, and it has a "fresh" 100% in Rotten Tomatoes. It is even considered as a masterpiece for some. Here are some reviews:
* '''Todd Gilchrist''': ''A stunning achievement and the most completely entertaining film I've seen in years.''
* '''Devin Faraci''': ''Inception is a masterpiece. Making a huge film with big ambitions, Christopher Nolan never missteps and manages to create a movie that, at times, feels like a miracle. ''
* '''Pete Hammond''': ''The acting, from a great ensemble led by DiCaprio, is as good as it gets. Special shout outs to Wally Pfister's extraordinary cinematography, the challenging and intricate production design of Guy Hendrix Dyas and Han's Zimmer's haunting score, which is his best in years.''
* '''Steven Snyder''': ''I expected a lot,but still walked out hypnotized. Here's a movie that's 3 steps ahead of you, on 4 different levels, at 5 blinding speeds. Best of 2010 thus far. ''
I hope this film will blow my mind away as Avatar did.
[[Category:Blog posts]]

'''This page helps you stay up to date with what's happening with the community aspect of the wiki.'''
*We have created a new [http://inception.answers.wikia.com/wiki/Inception_Answers Answers Wiki] so that all of your queries and questions about Inception can be resolved and you can finally go to sleep at night.
*We hope to have at least 500 articles by the end of 2010, so sign up and start editing and creating articles like mad! (Just don't make any bad edits, or you may find yourself in [[Limbo]]...
*Enjoy the rest of the wiki, we have an extensive collection of anything [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]] related, and if we don't have it, go ahead and create it!

{{Infobox actor |image=Johnny_Marr_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=Johnny Marr |birthname=John Martin Maher |born=Octorber 31, 1963 |died= |nationality=British |gender=Male |eye=Brown |hair=Black |height= |website=[http://johnny-marr.com/ Official Site] |yearsactive=1982 - Present |inceptionrole=Contributes guitar playing throughout the soundtrack |academyawards= }} '''Johnny Marr''' (born '''John Martin Maher''' on 31 October 1963 in Ardwick, Manchester) is an English songwriter, guitarist, keyboardist, harmonica player, and singer. Marr rose to fame in the 1980s as the guitarist in The Smiths, where he formed a prolific songwriting partnership with Morrissey. Marr has been a member of ''Electronic'', ''The The'', and ''Modest Mouse''. In 2008, he joined ''The Cribs'' after touring with them on 2008's NME Awards Tour. Marr plays guitar throughout the [[Inception: Music from the Motion Picture|soundtrack]] for the film ''[[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]]''. [[Category:Music]] [[Category:Production]] [[Category:Stub]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox company |logo=Legendary_Pictures_Infobox.png |logosize=250px |name=Legendary Pictures |type=Production company |industry=Motion pictures |founded=2005 |headquarters=Burbank, California, USA |area=Worldwide |keypeople=Thomas Tull
Jon Jashni
William Fay |products=Motion pictures |revenue= |income= |owner=Itself |parent= |website=[http://legendarypictures.com/ www.legendarypictures.com] }} '''Legendary Pictures''' is an American motion picture production company based in Burbank, California founded by Thomas Tull. The company has a 7-year, 40-picture agreement to co-produce and co-finance with [[Warner Bros.]], starting in 2005. Legendary Pictures' first full-length feature with Warner Bros. was the comic book movie, Batman Begins, soon followed by another comic book adaptation, Superman Returns. They made [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]] in partnership with Warner Bros. Legendary Pictures is the first company of its kind to pair major motion picture product with major Wall Street private equity and hedge fund investors and was subsequently named Media/Entertainment Deal of the Year by IDD Magazine. Legendary Pictures investors include ABRY Partners, AIG Direct Investments, Bank of America Capital Investors, Columbia Capital, Falcon Investment Advisors and M/C Venture Partners. In 2008, their president & CEO, Thomas Tull, became a minority partner in the Pittsburgh Steelers, purchasing a minority stake in order to keep controlling ownership within the Rooney family. Tull acquired a 16% stake in the team as part of the deal, though the Rooneys will remain as primary owners. In 2009, they announced they would be entering game development which surprised many gamers because of Hollywood's previous disengagement with that industry. [[es:Legendary Pictures]] [[Category:Production]] [[Category:Company]]

{{Infobox company |logo=Syncopy_Films_Infobox.png |logosize=250px |name=Syncopy Films |type=Production company |industry=Motion pictures |founded=London, England |headquarters=London, England |area=Worldwide |keypeople=[[Christopher Nolan]]
[[Emma Thomas]] |products=Motion pictures |revenue= |income= |owner=Christopher Nolan |parent= |website= }} '''Syncopy Films''' is a British/American production company founded by director, writer and producer [[Christopher Nolan]]. [[es:Syncopy Films]] [[Category:Production]] [[Category:Company]]

{{Infobox actor |image=Emma_Thomas.png |imagesize=250px |name=Emma Thomas |birthname= |born= |died= |nationality=American(?) |gender=Female |eye=Brown |hair=Dark Brown |height= |website= |yearsactive=1997-present |inceptionrole=Producer |academyawards= }} '''Emma Thomas''' is a film producer. She has been married to [[Christopher Nolan]] since 1997. She produces films which her husband writes and directs. These include ''Doodlebug'' (1997), ''Following'' (1998), ''Memento'' (2000), ''Insomnia'' (2002), ''Batman Begins'' (2005), ''The Prestige'' (2006), ''The Dark Knight'' (2008), and ''[[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]]'' (2010). She has also produced the animated, direct-to-DVD film ''Batman: Gotham Knight''.
==Personal Life==
She lives with husband Nolan and their three children in Los Angeles, California. [[Category:Production]]

revision.comment: Created page with 'Spoiler is slang for any element of any summary or description of any piece of fiction that reveals any plot element which will give away the outcome of a dramatic episode within…'
revision.text:
Spoiler is slang for any element of any summary or description of any piece of fiction that reveals any plot element which will give away the outcome of a dramatic episode within the work of fiction, or the conclusion of the entire work. Because enjoyment of fiction sometimes depends upon the dramatic tension and suspense which arises within it, the external revelation of such plot elements can "spoil" the enjoyment that some consumers of the narrative would otherwise have experienced.
Inception Wiki does not censor spoilers.

{{Heading|Featured Article}} [[File:Inception_Poster.jpg|right|250px]]'''''Inception''''' is a science-fiction action thriller film written, produced, and directed by [[Christopher Nolan]]. The film stars [[Leonardo DiCaprio]], with a supporting cast that includes [[Ken Watanabe]], [[Joseph Gordon-Levitt]], [[Marion Cotillard]], [[Ellen Page]], [[Cillian Murphy]], [[Tom Hardy]], [[Tom Berenger]], [[Dileep Rao]] and [[Michael Caine]]. The film was produced and distributed by [[Warner Bros.]] with co-production from [[Legendary Pictures]] and [[Syncopy Films]], Inception is scheduled to be released in both conventional and IMAX theaters on July 16, 2010. '''[[Inception_(2010_film)|Read more...]]'''

revision.text:
I was reading over Tectonium's post about information sources for the film, I thought I'd try to create a central area for links and other resources that you can go to if you're trying to find character information, pictures for infoboxes, etc. So please, post any links that you have been using or that you know about; we need to have some high quality articles to go along with our high quality layout. :P
Here are a few that I've found or I've saved from people posting them in the IRC:
*http://thefilmstage.com/2010/06/24/warner-bros-spills-the-beans-on-inception/ (Character info and direct quotes from Nolan) *http://www.cinematical.com/2010/06/24/interview-inception-cinematographer-wally-pfister/ (Interview with [[Wally Pfister]]) *http://www.nolanfans.com/2010/06/22/inception-character-featurette-now-online/ (Character info in video form) *http://www.ropeofsilicon.com/movie/inception/stills/ (A lot of pictures from the film and posters)
Those are the four that I have used the most, and I'd like to know what sorts of links you guys have come across, and post the links in your comments. [[Category:Blog posts]]

moved [[User blog:Matias arana 10/Inception Plot Revealed]] to [[User blog:Matias Arana/Inception Plot Revealed]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Matias arana 10|Matias arana 10]]" to "[[User:Matias Arana|Matias Arana]]"
revision.text:
Christopher Nolan’s “Inception” has made for one of the most tightly guarded projects to come along in quite some time. Plot descriptions have been relegated to “it’s a contemporary sci-fi actioner set within the architecture of the mind,” while the teaser trailer that debuted online yesterday and with select prints of “Inglourious Basterds” over the weekend was careful not to give away too much of the story. It was a teaser in the strictest sense of the word, and I fully respect Nolan for that.
I’ve heard that Nolan hates the internet. He is a director who respects the integrity of experiencing a film fresh and without the barrage of story-specific publicity that can ruin, or at the very least, lessen the impact of that experience. Having helmed two of the most hotly anticipated films of all time in “Batman Begins” and “The Dark Knight,” I can certainly understand how he might develop this position, if in fact he has. And “Inception,” with all it’s secrecy, has this same air of anticipation around it as fans and journalists clamor for more information. (A faux script review was even posted as an April Fools Day prank, drumming up tons of excitement.)
So with that in mind, you can probably understand why I would feel somewhat conflicted about revealing what I know of the “Inception” plot after the jump. I’ve sat on this for quite a while, actually, but with elevated interest in the project following the trailer debut, I thought it was a good time to spill.
'''PLEASE NOTE, IF YOU WANT TO REMAIN PURE AS TO WHAT THIS FILM HAS TO OFFER, DO NOT CONTINUE READING. I IMPLORE YOU. (THERE ARE SPOILERS.) BUT FOR THOSE HAPPY TO BE SPOILED, WELL THEN I'M HAPPY TO DIVULGE.'''
I have not read the script for “Inception,” so this information is all second hand from someone who has. If it seems vague in areas, it is because my source was recounting from memory. I can’t be 100% sure how much of this gels with the truth because WB publicity can’t comment on the film’s plot points. I’m not able to verify this with them. But it all seems fairly legitimate to me.
In a nutshell, the source says “Inception” takes place in a world where we have developed a means by which we can enter people’s dreams. Leonardo DiCaprio’s character Cobb has been described as a “CEO type,” but he is also something of a criminal. He dives into people’s dreams to extract information.
Ellen Page will play Ariadne, a young college student studying in Paris who is a part of Cobb’s team (along with Joseph Gordon-Levitt’s Arthur and Tom Hardy’s Eames). Cobb’s team actually “creates” the dreams and Ariadne is an “architect” of the them. She engineers them.
When Cobb’s team enters the dreams, it is not via a machine such as “The Matrix” or “The Cell,” I’m told. It is via injection, and the technology can easily be transported in a suitcase. In one scene (featured briefly in the trailer, I believe), the team actually enters a person’s dream while on an airplane.
Cillian Murphy stars as Fischer, a business-type who is soon to become the head of a company. Cobb’s team is attempting to insert an idea into Fischer’s mind to compel him to separate the company into two smaller companies. The reasoning for this is unclear on my end.
Ken Watanabe plays Saito, a character blackmailing Cobb. For what reason and to what extreme, I do not know. Aside from him, there is no classic villain in the story, but Cobb’s wife (Marion Cotillard) causes some trouble.
The two of them at some point find themselves stuck in many levels of a dream and Cobb’s wife tries to convince him to stay in that world, that it is much better than real life. However, Cobb wants to return to his children and the real world.
This plot point is a bit unclear '''(and is a MASSIVE SPOILER)''', but I’m told that the wife commits suicide in the dream in order to return to the real world. When Cobb himself returns, he is charged with his wife’s murder and has to flee with his children.
The film will not be typical sci-fi fare at all. It is set in the real world, present day. And virtually all of the “action” scenes take place in the dream environment. This should go a long way toward explaining the “Your mind is the scene of the crime” tagline that accompanied the trailer. Ultimately it seems like a grounded, more tangible blend of “Minority Report” and “The Matrix.”
That’s all I’ve got. If you’re still reading, your thoughts?
Source: http://incontention.com/?p=12388
----
This article is here thanks to Vinci Veni, who gave me the link, so thanks! PLEASE READ THE '''MASSIVE SPOILER''' WARNING, PLEASE! That thing just ruined the movie for me. Dammit.

[[File:extractor.png|right|thumb|250px|Cobb extracting [[Saito]]'s secrets]] {{Quote|''I know how to search your mind and find your secrets. I know the tricks. And I can teach them to you so even when you're asleep your defense is never down.''|||[[Cobb]]}}
An '''Extractor''' is a person who [[Extraction|extracts]] people's [[Projections|secrets]] through their [[The Dreams|dreams]]. At the core, an extractor is a classic con man – he creates a false set of circumstances that manipulate the subject into revealing his or her secrets. The difference is that those false sets of circumstances are created through dreams.
[[Dominick Cobb]] is the self-proclaimed "best Extractor out there", as he is hired by corporations with the goal of stealing secrets to which they would otherwise never have access.

{{Stub}} {{Infobox character |image=nash.jpg |imagesize=250px |name=Nash |born= |died= |lives=United States of America |gender=Male |status=Unknown |eye= |family= |occupation=[[Architect]] |loyalties= |portrayed=[[Lukas Haas]] |first=''[[Inception: The Cobol Job]]'' |last= }}'''Nash''' is an [[Architect|architect]] of [[The Dreams|Dreams]] who worked with [[Dominic Cobb|Dom]] on several jobs. Dom didn't trust him but he was the only architect available at the time. He made some mistakes as an architect, such as using polyester instead of wool for [[Saito]]'s rug. After apparently attempting to betray [[Arthur]] and Dom to Saito, Saito gave him over to the mercies of [[Cobol Engineering]]. He is portrayed by [[Lukas Haas]].
==Personality== Nash is a very nervous and excitable person, fidgeting constantly under the circumstances of a normal job.
[[es:Nash]] [[Category:Stub]] [[Category:Characters]]

{{Infobox actor |image=Lukashaas.jpg |imagesize=250px |name=Lukas Haas |birthname=Lukas Daniel Haas |born=April 16, 1976 |died= |nationality=American |gender=Male |eye=Brown |hair=Brown |height= |website= |yearsactive=1983–present |inceptionrole=[[Nash]] |academyawards= }} {{stub}} '''Lukas Daniel Haas''' (born April 16, 1976) is an American actor, known for roles both as a child and as an adult. His career has spanned more than 20 years during which time he has appeared in more than 36 feature films, as well as a number of television shows and theater productions. He portrays [[Nash]] in [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]]. [[Category:Stub]] [[Category:Production]] [[Category:Actors]]

{{Infobox actor |image=Tim kelleher.JPG |imagesize=250px |name=Tim Kelleher |birthname= |born=November 11, 1974 |died= |nationality=American |gender=Male |eye=Blue |hair=Brown |height= |website= |yearsactive= |inceptionrole=[[Thin Man]] |academyawards= }}
'''Tim Kelleher''' is an American writer, actor and director. He was born in the Bronx, and grew up across the five boroughs of New York City. After graduating college and a formative stint as a Jesuit novitiate, he returned to New York, where he trained as a stage actor under the tutelage of Robert Patterson. With his friends, he founded and served as Artistic Director of The Colony Theatre, producing the work of new playwrights as well as select classics.
His acting career has included guest appearances on numerous TV shows, and a turn as the resident villain on NBC's Sci-Fi series ''Dark Skies''. His more than two dozen film credits include ''Malcom X,'' ''Independence Day,'' ''The Negotiator,'' ''Thirteen Days,'' ''Flash of Genius,'' ''Seven Pounds'', and, most recently [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]].
He directed the short-form film ''The Skell'', starring John Costelloe, David Morse, Paul Giamatti, Nestor Serrano, Dianne Ramirez, and Joe Gannascoli. In 2008, he wrote and directed Wake-Up Call, a pilot, starring Nestor Serrano, Casey Siemaszko, Adam Ferrara, Peggy Scott, Amy Schumer and D.L. Anderson.
==Personal Life==
In 2008 Tim married the Canadian novelist Billie Livingston. He is currently at work on a documentary film for First Things Magazine. [[Category:Production]] [[Category:Actors]]

[[File:dream.png|thumb|right|250px|The world of dreams]] {{Quote|''I thought that the dream space should be all about the visual, but it's more about the feel of it. My question is what happens when you mess with the physics of it all?''|||[[Ariadne]]}} '''Dreams''' are an integral part of the World of the Dream. They are the sensory representations of an individuals' subconscious, and are present in every living person. Through [[Dream-Sharing]], dreams can be manufactured within other individuals' minds.
There are three types of roles in dreams:
*[[Dreamer|The Dreamer]]: The Dreamer creates and maintains the dream space.
*[[Subject|The Subject]]: The Subject populates the dream space with [[projections]] of his or her subconscious.
*Other [[Sleepers]]: Sleepers can manipulate reality within dreams, but not the fundamental structure of the dream. The [[Extraction]] process is possible thanks to how the mind works when people are sleeping. When we are dreaming, we create and perceive our world simultaneously. Our mind makes it so well that we are not aware of the change. That allows the [[Extractor]]s to get right in the middle of that process.
When a Extraction team is working, the Subject never knows he is dreaming, like in normal dreams. But the Dreamers can tell to the Subject that he is dreaming; when the Subject understands he's dreaming, the strange things that happen in the Dream happen again, to show the Subject he's actually Dreaming. This tactic is known as [[Mr. Charles (Tactic)|Mr. Charles]], and it's used to turn the Subject against his own subconscious, but it has a failure; when the Subject is convinced that he's Dreaming, the subconscious automatically looks for the Dreamer.
Outside of the manufactured dreams exists [[Limbo]], a shared dream space with no single dreamer. This space is the deepest anyone can travel within the mind. It is described as "raw and infinite subconscious".

{{Infobox actor |image=Leesmith.jpg |imagesize=250px |name=Lee Smith |birthname= |born=1960 |died= |nationality=American |gender=Male |eye= |hair=White |height= |website= |yearsactive= |inceptionrole=Editor |academyawards= }}'''Lee Smith''' (born 1960) is an ACE-certified film editor. He began his career as a sound editor/sound designer for films such as Dead Calm (1989), The Piano (1993) (for which he was nominated for the BAFTA Award for Best Sound), The Portrait of a Lady (1996) and Holy Smoke! (1999). Smith was also editing films during this interval; he was one of the editors for Robocop 2 (1990).
He began his notable collaboration with director Peter Weir on the 1982 film The Year of Living Dangerously, on which he was an associate editor working with Weir's longtime editor William M. Anderson. He was credited as a co-editor with Anderson for Fearless (1993) and for The Truman Show (1998). He was the sole editor for Weir's Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World (2003), for which Smith was nominated for the Academy Award for Film Editing and for an "Eddie Award" from the American Cinema Editors.
More recently, Smith has edited four films with director [[Christopher Nolan]]. He was nominated for a second Academy Award and American Cinema Editors Award for The Dark Knight (2008). [[Category:Production]]

{{Infobox character |image=Th-1-.jpg |imagesize=250px |name=Maurice Fischer |born= |died= |lives= |gender=Male |status=Deceased |eye= |family=[[Robert Fischer]] |occupation= |loyalties= |portrayed=[[Pete Postlethwaite]] |first=''[[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]]'' |last=}}
'''Maurice Fischer''' is [[Robert Fischer]]'s dying father and the founder of [[Fischer Morrow]], the main competitor of Saito's company, [[Proclus Global]], in the energy industry. Because he believes Fischer's company will become a new superpower with no competition from anyone, Saito believes it is necessary to orchestrate the dissolution of Fischer Morrow, taking advantage of Maurice Fischer's deteriorating state to perform an [[Inception (tactic)|inception]] on Maurice's son. Fischer Sr. dies shortly after the [[The Team|Team]] has completed their preparations for the Inception, to be executed as Robert Fischer escorts his father's casket back to Los Angeles on a flight from Sydney, Australia.
Maurice's relationship with his son is publicly known to be very strained. Instead, Robert is considerably closer to [[Peter Browning]], his godfather and Maurice's long time legal counsel. However, is implied that Robert longs for his father's acknowledgment. When the idea to break up Maurice's company is implanted in Robert, it is done so by the emotional idea that Maurice wanted Robert to be his own man and had been unable to express to his son that he loved him.
==Gallery== <gallery> 488325-maurice_large-1-.png|Projection of Maurice reconciling with Robert. </gallery>
