revision.text: The people chasing him are from Cobol Engineering, the company that hired Cobb and his team to extract the plan from Saito's mind. As Cobb ultimately ended up working for Saito, Cobol hired people to kill him.

revision.comment: Created page with 'He is the "Mark", meaning that he is Cobb's team's target. They have to implant the idea that he should dissolve Fischer Morrow, his father's energy company, when his father dies…'
revision.text: He is the "Mark", meaning that he is Cobb's team's target. They have to implant the idea that he should dissolve Fischer Morrow, his father's energy company, when his father dies, as he is the heir to the top job.

revision.comment: Created page with 'to Anonymous user 13:21, July 27, 2010: Eames is in Fischer's office observing Browning in real life. Saito says that in order to get closer, he would need some very good refere…'
revision.text:
to Anonymous user 13:21, July 27, 2010:
Eames is in Fischer's office observing Browning in real life. Saito says that in order to get closer, he would need some very good references. Eames replies, (paraphrasing) "References are a speciality of mine." This would lead me to believe that Eames knows some high-up people who referred him and whose reference is held in high regard. Eames is a forger, his personality is one of deception which makes it very easy to get whatever you need.
I love this movie, and exploring all the different theories is awesome :-)

{{Infobox dream |image=The_City_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=New York Streets |level=1 |dreamer=[[Yusuf]] |subject=[[Robert Fischer]] |kick=Van hitting the guardrail (unsuccessful)
Van hitting the water (successful) |sleepers=[[Dom Cobb]]
[[Ariadne]]
[[Eames]]
[[Saito]]
[[Arthur]]}} The '''New York''' dream was the first dream level in the [[The Fischer Inception Job|heist]] on [[Robert Fischer]]'s mind. It was dreamt by [[Yusuf]]. When the sleepers first enter the New York dream, [[Arthur]], [[Eames]], and [[Saito]] kidnap Fischer. Fischer hands Eames his wallet, telling him to take it and leave. The moment Eames takes the wallet Fischer's [[Projections|projections]] begin to attack [[Dominic Cobb|Cobb's]] [[The Team|team]]. Meanwhile, Cobb's subconscious inserts a freight train into the middle of the street (the same freight train that Cobb and [[Mallorie Cobb|Mal]] committed suicide under while in [[Limbo]]), splitting up the team, and allowing Saito to be shot. Eventually, the team regroups in a warehouse and establishes that Fischer has trained his subconscious to defend itself from extraction and invasion. Certain security projections are militarized. Cobb's team becomes concerned and learns that death within this [[Dream|dream]] cannot wake a [[Sleeper|sleeper]] due to the strength of the sedative, only send the sleeper's mind to Limbo. The team decides to continue the mission anyway. Eames forges the identity of [[Peter Browning|Browning]] and tells Fischer of an alternate will that [[Maurice Fischer|Fischer Sr.]] created to split up his [[Fischer Morrow|company]]. The sleepers load into a van and all enter the [[The Hotel (dream)|Level 2 dream]], with the exception of Yusuf, who drives the van, trying to avoid the projections. Yusuf tosses the van around and flips it over at one point. Eventually, Yusuf reaches a bridge, sets off a musical cue in Arthur's ears, and administers a [[Kick|kick]] to the sleepers by driving the van into the railing on the bridge. Because the kicks in the other dream levels are not synchronized the kick does not have any effect. The van falls off the bridge and hits the water, administering a second kick that is synchronized with kicks in the other dream levels and wakes all the sleepers back to Level 1 (The City). Fischer and Eames, who is still disguised as Browning, swim to shore and Fischer shows that the [[Inception (tactic)|Inception]] was successful. [[es:La Ciudad (sueño)]] [[Category:Places]] [[Category:Levels of the Fischer Inception Job]]

revision.comment: moved [[Talk:Inception (Music from the Motion Picture)/@comment-74.237.180.58-20100803045013]] to [[Talk:Inception: Music from the Motion Picture/@comment-74.237.180.58-20100803045013]]: Title did not have parens in it and subtitles are usually put af
revision.text: The 12th track "Time" is the STAR track of the soundtrack!

{{Infobox dream |image=The_Hotel_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=The Hotel |level=2 |dreamer=[[Arthur]] |subject=[[Robert Fischer]] |kick=Explosives blow out the floor (never used)
Explosives propel the elevator upward |sleepers=[[Dom Cobb]]
[[Ariadne]]
[[Eames]]
[[Saito]]}} '''The Hotel''' was the second dream level in the [[The Fischer Inception Job|heist]] on [[Robert Fischer|Fischer's]] mind. It was dreamt by [[Arthur]]. [[Eames]] enters The Hotel dream [[Forger|disguised]] as a blonde woman speaking to Fischer at the bar. As [[Cobb]] approaches, Eames pickpockets Fischer's wallet and leaves, drawing the attention of Fischer's security [[projections]] and buying Cobb time to attempt a risky con. Cobb pretends to be a projection of Fischer's subconscious named [[Mr. Charles (tactic)|Mr. Charles]]. Cobb draws Fischer's [[Lucid Dreaming|attention]] to the fact that he is dreaming and helps him remember that he has been kidnapped in [[New York (dream)|The City]]. Cobb makes Fischer believe that his own true projections are in fact the kidnappers attempting to commit [[Extraction]] on Fischer's mind. At one point of the conversation, a waiter accidentally breaks a glass, which interrupts Cobb(because the sound of the glass breaking is identical to the one he stepped on in the hotel room that Mal killed herself) and projections of his children appearing in the hotel at some points. Meanwhile, Arthur and [[Ariadne]] set explosive charges in room [[528491 (number)|491,]] which is directly beneath room 528, where the [[The Team|team]] intends to sleep. When given the cue by [[Yusuf]] in The City, Arthur intends to detonate the explosives, causing the floor of 528 to give out, dropping himself and the [[Sleeper|sleepers]] and creating a [[Kick|kick]]. Arthur says that it's important that he is able to synchronize the kick with the van hitting the rail in The City, or else he will be forced to administer a different kick in zero gravity while the van is in free fall into the water. Cobb assembles Fischer and the rest of [[The Team|the team]] in room 528 when Fischer's projection of [[Peter Browning]] walks in. The projection states that he is working with the kidnappers so that he can gain access to the alternate will and divide up the [[Fischer Morrow|company]], which is what [[Maurice Fischer|Fischer Sr.]] always wanted his son to do. Cobb convinces Fischer to enter Browning's mind and discover the truth and Fischer agrees. Unknown to Fischer, the team is actually preparing to enter his mind, creating a [[Snow-Covered Mountains (dream)|third level]] to commit [[Inception (tactic)|Inception]] in. Arthur stays awake and leads Fischer's militarized projections away from the sleepers. At this point, due to Yusuf's reckless driving in Level 1, the hotel spins 360 degrees as Arthur kills off the projections. Finally, Arthur hears the musical cue from Yusuf and rushes to warn the sleepers that the kick is coming, but is too late and misses the first kick. The feeling of free fall on Arthur's body in Level 1 translates to weightlessness in The Hotel. Due to the lack of gravity, Arthur is forced to prepare a different kick. Arthur moves the sleepers into the elevator, where he plants the charges. When the van hits the water, Arthur detonates the charges, which propel the elevator and create a kick that wakes the sleepers from Level 3, and synchs with the kick in Level 1, allowing them to all wake from the Hotel. [[es:El Hotel (sueño)]] [[Category:Places]] [[Category:Levels of the Fischer Inception Job]]

{{Infobox dream |image=The_Mountain_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=The Snow-Covered Mountains |level=3 |dreamer=[[Eames]] |subject=[[Robert Fischer]] |kick=Using explosives to destroy support beams |sleepers=[[Dom Cobb]]
[[Ariadne]]
[[Saito]] }} The '''Snow-Covered Mountains''' dream was the third dream level in [[The Fischer Inception Job|the inception]] on [[Robert Fischer|Fischer's]] mind. It was dreamt by [[Eames]]. In this dream, [[Dominic Cobb|Cobb]] has tricked Fischer into working with [[The Team|the team]] to break into his own subconscious (using the [[Mr. Charles (tactic)|Mr. Charles tactic]]) to perform [[Inception (tactic)|Inception]]. Eames, as the one who knows the dream and can navigate the maze, leads Fischer's [[Projections|projections]] on a chase as Fischer and [[Saito]] make their way to the hospital. The musical cue warning that the van in [[The City (Dream)|Level 1]] will hit the rail of the bridge begins to sound, but the [[Sleeper|sleepers]] in the Mountain fail to hear it. When the van does hit the rail, it causes an avalanche on the Mountain. Cobb realizes that the only other [[Kick|kick]] from Level 1 will come when the van hits the water, so the team needs to hurry. [[Ariadne]] tells Cobb of a shortcut, which allows [[Mallorie Cobb|Mal]] to enter the dream. Mal shoots Fischer and kills him, sending his mind to [[Limbo]]. Cobb then shoots Mal. With Fischer dead, the team is prepared to give up on the Inception attempt, but Ariadne suggests that she and Cobb rescue Fischer from within Limbo, administering a kick to sync with another kick in Level 3 to wake him. Eames agrees and sedates Ariadne and Cobb. Eames then plants the charges that will trigger the mass kick later. After completing that, Eames uses a defibrillator on Fischer, which in unison with the kick administered in Limbo, wakes him. Meanwhile, Saito dies of the gunshot wound he received in Level 1. Fischer, now awake and alive, enters the vault of the hospital which contains a projection of his dying [[Maurice Fischer|father]], who in turn tells Fischer that he was only ever disappointed that Fischer wanted to be like him, considering it an unworthy fate for his son. At this point, Inception has occurred and Ficher is convinced that he must split up his [[Fischer Morrow|company]]. Once Inception has occurred, Eames detonates the charges, causing a mass kick that, in conjunction with a kick from within Limbo, wakes Ariadne. The kick also allows the sleepers in Level 3, including Ariadne and Fischer to all wake from Level 3. [[es:La Montaña (sueño)]] [[Category:Places]] [[Category:Levels of the Fischer Inception Job]]

{{youmay|the dream|[[The Palace (limbo)|the castle Saito constructs in Limbo]]}} {{Infobox dream |image=Inception_Palace.jpg |imagesize=250px |name=The Japanese Castle |level=2 |dreamer=[[Arthur]] |subject=[[Saito]] |kick=None |sleepers=[[Dominic Cobb|Cobb]] }} '''The Japanese Castle''' was the second dream level in the heist on [[Saito]]'s mind. It was dreamt by [[Arthur]].
[[Dominic Cobb|Cobb]] and Arthur speak to Saito in the Palace, offering their services to help him learn to protect his mind from theft. However, Saito sees the truth, that Cobb and Arthur are actually planning on committing [[extraction]] on his mind when his guard is down. Cobb and Arthur walk around the dream and plan, and Cobb sees his projection of [[Mal]]. Cobb splits up from Arthur to speak with Mal and perform the extraction.
He is interrupted by Saito and Mal, who begin to torture a kidnapped Arthur. Cobb shoots Arthur to wake him up, but his absence causes the dream to collapse. The collapse causes debris to fall, which kills and wakes Saito. Meanwhile, Cobb reads the information he extracted, but notes some parts are blacked out, indicating Satio is still holding on to his more personal secrets. Suddenly, the dream begins to fill with water as Cobb's sleeping body in [[The Apartment (Dream)|Level 1]] is kicked into a bathtub, waking Dom up.
==Gallery== <gallery> Saito Cobb Arthur Dinner.jpg|Saito, Cobb, and Arthur having dinner in the Japanese palace </gallery>
==References== <references/>
[[es:El Palacio (sueño)]] [[Category:Places]] [[Category:Stub]] [[Category:Levels of the Saito Extraction Job]]

{{Infobox dream |image=The_Apartment_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=The Dilapidated Hotel Room |level=1 |dreamer=Nash |subject=Saito |kick=Falling into a bathtub |sleepers=Dom Cobb
Arthur }} '''The Dilapidated Hotel Room''' was the first dream level in the heist on [[Saito|Saito's]] mind. It was dreamt by [[Nash]]. Nash created the dream as a replica of a real hotel room that Saito kept to facilitate affairs. When the film opens, all the sleepers but Nash are already in the [[The Palace (dream)|second dream level]] and Saito's [[Projections|projections]] are raging outside. [[Arthur]] is the first to wake, but as he is the dreamer of the Palace, he knows that it's only a matter of time before the Palace dream collapses. Arthur rushes to further [[Somnacin|sedate]] Saito before he wakes, but is too late. Meanwhile, Nash attempts to wake Cobb before Saito by [[Kick|pushing]] him into a bathtub. Cobb wakes and overpowers Saito, demanding the information that he failed to extract in the Palace dream. Saito tells the trio that he is unimpressed with them, and had only let them enter his mind to test them for a future [[The Fischer Inception Job|job]]. Suddenly, a musical cue begins to sound through the dream, warning Cobb that the dream will soon end. Arthur is woken up. Cobb pushes Saito to the ground and demands the information again, but Saito [[Lucid Dreaming|discovers]] that he is still dreaming when he feels that his carpet is not made of the proper material. Upon realizing this, his projections burst into the room and kill Nash and Cobb, while Saito looks on, bewildered. [[es:El Apartamento (sueño)]] [[Category:Places]] [[Category:Stub]] [[Category:Article stubs]] [[Category:Levels of the Saito Extraction Job]]

{{Infobox dream |image=Paris_Streets_Infobox.png |imagesize=250px |name=Paris Streets |level=1 |dreamer=Ariadne |subject=Dom Cobb |kick=None |sleepers=None }} The '''Paris Street''' is the dream in which [[Dominic Cobb|Cobb]] allows [[Ariadne]] to first play with manipulating [[The Dreams|dreams]]. The Parisian Street are dreamt by Ariadne.
It starts on the same street as the [[Parisian Café (dream)|Parisian Café]] though Ariadne forgot the book shop and a few other minor things. Here Cobb allowed her to experience the way a [[Dreamer|dreamer]] can build and manipulate dreams in order for her to better design dream worlds for the heist on Fischer's mind.
Ariadne is immediately able to comprehend the mechanics of the dream world and begins altering the architecture of the dream excessively, an action that Cobb warns will draw the attention of his [[Projections|projections]]. She eventually decides to build a bridge she know in the real world. This causes Cobb to warn Ariadne not create dreams based on memories, because when memories begin to mix with dreams, the dreamer begins to lose track of reality.
Eventually, despite Cobb's best efforts, his projections assault Ariadne before Mal stabs her and wakes her up. [[es:Calles de París (sueño)]] [[Category:Places]]

{{Infobox dream |image=parisian cafe dream.jpg |imagesize=300px |name=Paris Café |level=1 |dreamer=Ariadne |subject=Dom Cobb |kick=None |sleepers=None }} The '''Parisian Café''' was the [[dream]] in which [[Dominic Cobb|Cobb]] first introduced [[Ariadne]] to [[Dream-Sharing|shared dreaming]]. It was dreamt by Ariadne.
Cobb brought Ariadne into one of her own dreams in order to show how shared dreaming actually works, and how simple it can be to manipulate someone into accepting a dream as reality. When Cobb [[Lucid Dreaming|reveals]] to Ariadne that she has been dreaming through their entire conversation, she panics and loses control of the dream, causing it to collapse.
[[es:Café de París (sueño)]] [[Category:Places]] [[Category:Stub]]

{{Infobox dream |image=Penrose_Stairs.jpg |imagesize=300px |name=Penrose Stairs |level=1 |dreamer=[[Arthur]] |subject=[[Ariadne]] |kick=None |sleepers=None }} The '''Penrose Stairs''' was the dream in which [[Arthur]] explained to [[Ariadne]] the importance of mazes and paradoxical architecture to creating a convincing [[The Dreams|dream space]].
The Penrose Stairs dream was dreamt by Arthur.
==Gallery== <gallery> Penrose_Stairs2.jpg|Paradox... </gallery>
[[es:Escalera de Penrose (sueño)]] [[Category:Places]]

[[File:Sleepers.png|thumb|right|300px|Sleepers in [[Yusuf]]'s dream den]] A "'''sleeper'''" is a person who is experiencing a [[Dream-Sharing|shared dream]]. Except in [[Limbo]], one or two sleepers must take on the roles of the [[subject]], who populates the [[The Dreams|dream]] with [[projections]], and the [[dreamer]], who constructs the dream.
A sleeper may be both the dreamer and the subject, even if others are present in the dream. Other sleepers can manipulate reality in the dream but not the fundamental construction of the dream. A sleeper's body within a dream is a projection of their mind and can thus be [[forging|manipulated]] by a sleeper if they know how.
==Gallery== <gallery> Basement dreaming.jpg|Sleepers sharing dreams in [[Yusuf]]'s dream den </gallery>

[[File:Inception_Mrcharles.jpg|thumb|300px|Cobb speaks to Fischer as "Mr. Charles".]] {{Quote|'''[[Ariadne]]''': ''Who or what is "Mr. Charles"?''
'''[[Arthur]]''': ''It's a gambit designed to turn [[Robert Fischer|Fischer]] against his own subconscious.''||}}
'''Mr. Charles''' is a tactic used by [[Dominic Cobb]]. The point of this tactic is to convince the [[Subject]] that Cobb is a [[projection]] of their subconscious named Mr. Charles.
This is accomplished by making the subject [[Lucid Dreaming|realize]] that they are in a [[The Dreams|dream]] and believing that Cobb is a special projection in charge of defending the subject's mind. By gaining the subject's trust, Cobb can then ally the subject with his entire [[The Team|team]] and turn the subject against his true projections.
The riskiest part of the Mr. Charles tactic is that it requires the subject to be aware that they are dreaming, causing the subject's projections to search wildly for the [[Dreamer|dreamer]]. If Cobb cannot adequately pull off the con then the projections may quickly kill him and his team like during the [[The Stein Extraction Job]].

{{Infobox dream |image=Inception_Cobb_Memory_Elevator.jpg |imagesize=250px |name=Dom's Memories |level=1 |dreamer=Dom Cobb |subject=Dom Cobb |kick=None |sleepers=Ariadne }} '''Dom's Memories''' is [[Dominick Cobb|Dom's]] recreation of his memories via [[Dream-Sharing]]. It was dreamt by Dominick Cobb.
Cobb, rendered unable to dream naturally due to overuse of Dream-Sharing technology, makes a habit of forcing himself to dream by having himself sedated by a [[PASIV Device]] when he goes to sleep.
Within his [[The Dreams|dreams]] Cobb is able to create a world out of his most impacting memories, keeping them locked in different floors like a building, where he can relive them.
One night Ariadne finds Cobb dreaming and enters his dream, only to find that he has made a prison for himself where he can never move beyond his traumatic past.
[[es:Memorias de Dominic Cobb (sueño)]] [[Category:Places]] [[Category:Stub]]

[[File:Placeholder|thumb|220px]] ==About me==
Hello Dreamers!
I'm ParadoxDarling. The name, as you might have guessed, comes from my two favorite lines of my two favorite characters. Those characters are The Point Man and the Forger, Arthur and Eames, and the lines are...
"You musn't be afraid to dream a little bigger, darling."
and,
"Paradox."
So far, I've seen Inception three times and I fully intend to see it at least once more (preferably in IMAX!) before it leaves theaters. Otherwise, the wait for the DVD release might be unbearable. The unbelievably deep and well thought out premise of this film has me totally entranced and I can already see myself developing an enduring obsession with the concepts of dream-sharing, kicks, and extractions...and probably with the slick and sexy Point Man who holds the team together. :o)
If I was in the world of Inception I would probably be either an Architect (though one who built dreams with words rather than pictures...seeing as I can't draw) or a Forger and my totem would be an old dip pen that could write on its own in a dream.
My other intrests include (but are in no way limited to): Star Wars (I'm a total SW nerd), The Beatles, Harry Potter, Shakespeare, and Batman. I've actually never joined/participated in a wiki before...though I do spend too much time roaming about Wookieepedia. I'm very excited to be a part of "the team" here on the Inception Wiki though and can't wait to watch this fandom grow!

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-99.230.3.76-20100804135120]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-99.230.3.76-20100804135120]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsonius]]"...
revision.text:
I'm going to throw something out here, and people will probably think I'm crazy but... I think Dom Cobb is dead.
I think he and Mal died when they originally experimented with deeper levels of dream sharing and entering limbo. Limbo could be seen as an equivalent to heaven. For Mal, it was everything she ever wanted. They could live like gods and she could grow old together with Cobb. The same is true for Cobb, except that he felt regret over leaving their children.
So, when Cobb convinced Mal to kill herself in limbo with him, he is pulling her into a lower level of afterlife (essentially purgatory). Cobb is happy there because he can be with his children, but Mal knows that they've left something better.
When Mal kills herself she goes back to the real limbo/heaven and Cobb is thrust into an even lower level of afterlife (hell.. which is exactly the outcome Mal tells him will happen, should Cobb decide to not follow her).
Everything in the film is Cobb's struggle to get back to a higher stage of afterlife (back to purgatory). The characters are all projections of Cobb and every world we see, including limbo with Ariadne, Fischer and Saito, are all worlds created by Cobb in his attempt to redeem himself. This is why "limbo" looks all torn up and is still inhabited by Shadow Mal at the end of the film.
Once Cobb is able to get over his guilt of "killing" Mal, and is able to complete the job from Saito, he goes back to purgatory. It's my guess that he will remain there until he has "lived" a life with his children or no longer feels the need to be tied to them. Then he'll go back to the real limbo (possibly with Mal waiting for him). I think deep down Cobb know's the truth of his situation (which is why his projections give hints) but he is constantly fighting the realization.
Evidence: -Cobb admits he and Mal screwed up when experimenting with dream sharing and says they "didn't know what they were doing." - Cobb's children on the phone don't understand the difference between Cobb being away and Mal's death. - Saito and Mal telling Cobb to take a leap of faith. -Miles telling Cobb to get back to reality, and telling him that buying stuffed animals will not change the fact that Cobb's children "have no father". -The top means nothing because Cobb admits to "corrupting it".

The number '''528491''' is a series of random digits that [[Robert Fischer]] gives to the [[The Team|team]].
In the [[The City (Dream)|City]] dream, [[Dominic Cobb|Cobb]] demands the first six digits that come into Fischer's mind, telling him that they may be the password to a safe containing his [[Maurice Fischer|father's]] alternate will. In actuality, Cobb's team just needs Fischer to invent a password to the safe where his subconscious hides his secrets.
Interestingly, the hex colour [http://www.colorhexa.com/528491 #528491] is similar to the palette chosen for the film's cover, though this could simply be a coincidence.
==Other Appearances== *In the [[The Hotel (dream)|Hotel]], when [[Eames]], disguised as Blonde, gives a number to Fischer that has six digits: 528-491. *In the Hotel, the team sleeps in room 528, and [[Arthur]] sets explosive charges beneath them in room 491 *In the [[The Mountain (Dream)|Mountain]], Fischer opens the safe with the numbers 528491.
==Gallery== <gallery> Six digit phone number.png|The bar napkin that [[Eames]] gives to [[Robert Fischer]] room 491.png|[[Arthur]] and [[Ariadne]] enter room 491 room 528.png|The door to room 528 safe combination.png|The combination to the safe </gallery>
==See Also== * [[528491 (music)]]

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-220.255.7.198-20100804175931]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-220.255.7.198-20100804175931]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text: The biggest problem I have with the "Cobb is in the dream/limbo" at some point more than we know theory is basically because the kicks are supposed to be fail-safes. What then, he invented levels of dreams in limbo AND ignored the physical laws of dreams that have been set out (how did he fall so many times and go through so many kicks without ever awakening, since death isn't the only way to wake up) ? Granted, some of these laws have been by-passed, but given the prevalence of several concept, you'd think they'd be decently iron-glad.

'''Chris Nolan Research Footage''' is a video that combines reality with elements from the world of [[Inception (2010 film)|Inception]]. It starts with [[Christopher Nolan]] interviewing one sleep expert and then another. Then it switches to the world of Inception where an unknown female speaks of normal dreaming, dream manipulation while [[Lucid Dreaming]], [[Project Somnacin]], and [[Dream-Sharing]]. Next, it goes to a phone interview with [[Darren Bartel|Captain Darren Bartel]] who speaks further about the military's Project Somnacin. At the end, it switches back to reality where the first researcher talks about how it isn't possible to manipulate dreams even when lucid dreaming.
It may be found [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mEItJLwvsF0&feature=player_embedded here.] [[Category:Stub]]

<center>{{quote|'''I need him to decide to break up his father's empire.'''}}</center> [[File:Trailer01.jpg|thumb|[[Dom Cobb]] using the [[Mr. Charles]] tactic|316px]] '''The Fischer Inception Job''' refers to a radical and risky operation undertaken by [[Dom Cobb]] and [[The Team|his team]] almost immediately after the failure of [[The Saito Extraction Job]]. The goal of the mission is to achieve [[Inception_(tactic)|Inception]] by planting idea to break up [[Maurice Fischer|his father's]] empire into [[Robert Fischer]]'s mind, a decision that would be beneficial to [[Saito]]'s company, [[Proclus Global]] (which is a competitor of [[Fischer Morrow]]) and to the world at large as it would prevent the creation of another "superpower" due to the company's widespread control of energy resources. Dom Cobb is talked into leading the operation by Saito on the grounds that if he succeeds, Saito will "make a phone call" and ensure that the charges against him will be dropped and he will be able to return to his family. All team members will also recieve payment for their work; Cobb has promised his share to [[Yusuf]] in return for his not informing the other dreamers that they are in risk of falling into [[limbo]]. The planning, execution, and outcome of this job form the primary plot of the film [[Inception_(2010_film)|Inception]]. ==The Basic Plan== In order to ensure that the idea is implanted "deep" enough in [[Robert Fischer]]'s head, Dom and the team plan an unconventional three level dream or a "dream within a dream within a dream." The goal of these dreams is to bring the enormous business decision of breaking up the empire down to the simple, emotional level of Robert Fischer reconciling with his father. In [[The City (dream)|the first level]] of the dream, [[Eames]] impersonates Fisher's godfather, [[Peter Browning]], and mentions an alternative will to dissolve the company. "Browning" acts suspiciously; although he screams, he is never shown being tortured. [[Robert Fischer|Fischer]] therefore makes the assumption that "Browning" is working with the kidnappers, as indeed [[Eames]] is; that Browning didn't want [[Fischer Morrow]] dissolved by the alternate will and, by extention, that there is a reason he, Fischer, would, and that there is therefore something being held back from him; "Browning" mentions that [[Maurice Fischer|his father]] loved Fischer, so Fischer makes the leap to guess that what "Browning" wants to hide is that his father wanted him to be his own man. The team also hold Fisher at gunpoint, forcing him to create a random digit of numbers (528491) to create a password for his subconscious' secrets.
They progress onto the next level, [[The Hotel (dream)|the hotel]]. Dom pretends to be a projection, "[[Mr. Charles (tactic)|Mr Charles]]", to win Fischer's trust, and points out that [[Eames]], as blonde, has stolen Fischer's wallet. Dom draws Fischer's attention to the massive gravity shifts and the odd weather (a wall of water hits the window, corresponding to a raindrop hitting Arthur's body in [[The City (dream)|the city]]) to point out that he is dreaming. This leads his projections to search for the dreamer. However, the gambit works as Dom manages to convince Fischer that he and his team are projections and that it is the true projections that are extractors. The killing of two projections who followed them leads Fischer to feel safe, causing the projections to act much less aggressively than in the city. Fischer's projection of Browning enters and acts based exactly how, from experience, Fischer expects him to: he tells him that he doesn't want the will released and that [[Fischer Morrow]] had been his whole life; given Eames' acting on the first level, the projection confesses to be working with the kidnappers to prevent the dissolution, exactly what Fischer thought about "Browning" on the first level. The team, with Fischer now as a team member, prepare to commit "extraction" on "Browning's" mind; however, as this is only his projection of Browning, the "secrets" are what Fischer assumed in level 1 that browning was hiding from him: that his father wanted him to be his own man. In the [[The Mountain (dream)|third level]], Projection Browning hides his "secret", which would be Fischer's motive for dissolving [[Fischer Morrow]], in the safe room; with the assistance of the team, Fischer enters the safe room, finds the "secret" and assumes it to be true, causing [[inception]].
==Dreams== * Level 1 - [[New York (dream)|New York]] * Level 2 - [[The Hotel (dream)|The Hotel]] * Level 3 - [[Snow-Covered Mountains (dream)|Snow-Covered Mountains]]
[[es:Trabajo de Origen de Fischer]] [[Category:Jobs]]

revision.text: I think it's two movies in one so everyone can have the ending they want.

revision.comment: Created page with "In response to the ring: The ring cannot be a totem because the ring only exists in dreams. For the same reason you could say Mal is a totem. Both are projections of Cobb's sub…"
revision.text:
In response to the ring:
The ring cannot be a totem because the ring only exists in dreams. For the same reason you could say Mal is a totem. Both are projections of Cobb's subconscious and, like Mal says in flashback, if he doesn't know he's dreaming then he won't be able to alter anything. All the ring shows is that Cobb believes he's dreaming. It's subjective, a totem is objective.
In response to the question about memories:
Cobb says that when you begin to build dreams from your memories then it becomes increasingly more difficult to differentiate between what's real and what's not real. That's what happened to Mal in Limbo.

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-76.93.133.117-20100804235240]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-76.93.133.117-20100804235240]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text:
If it means sequel, then I vote limbo lmao
But yeah. What Anon 23:03 said I think is right about on it. I can honestly see both endings, and I believe both endings to be true, and that it's pretty much two movies in one. It's all relative to how one perceived everything.

revision.comment: Created page with "Apparently Sarah (Skxwang) can't add a comment, so she asked me through the IRC to comment it here: ''I agree, the top 10 stuff should be blogs rather than lists. We had that he…"
revision.text:
Apparently Sarah (Skxwang) can't add a comment, so she asked me through the IRC to comment it here:
''I agree, the top 10 stuff should be blogs rather than lists. We had that here on Avatar, with everyone putting in their favorite scene. It lead to a number of discussions that was good for the wiki. ''
''I still think we need to get rid of the article comments. I have been busy lately, but I check in several times a day and delete the inappropriate comments. And there have been a number of them. And some have been VERY inappropriate. ''
''I don't like the idea of opinion pages. Article information needs to be canon. Opinion can be discussed in the talk pages and added in only if it is canon.''

And so the rename-athalon has finally come to an end. I moved Phillipa to [[Phillipa Cobb]], James to [[James Cobb]], Inception (2010 film) to [[Inception (2010 Film)]], and had Matias move Dom Cobb to [[Dominic Cobb]]. Then I also redirected all the links I could get my hands on to the proper pages. All of this while the database was locked so on most of them I had to hit Save Page multiple times to get it to actually save and it took a while to load. I hope I don't need to do anything this intensive for a while. [[Category:Blog posts]]
Nice work, Bastian.

revision.comment: Created page with "Really great job. I've been working on a little bug in a new skin for the wiki that I've been testing, so I'm glad someone stepped up to the plate and got things done. Great work…"
revision.text: Really great job. I've been working on a little bug in a new skin for the wiki that I've been testing, so I'm glad someone stepped up to the plate and got things done. Great work!

The pages that only admins can edit, user comments, and user pages are the pages I couldn't edit. They still have links that lead to redirects on them (the first link on the front page is an example of this).
Thanks for the appreciation. I kind of needed it after the hours I spent on that project.

[[File:architect.png|thumb|350px|An architect designs the dream space]] {{Quote|''...it's the chance to build cathedrals, entire cities, things that never existed. Things that couldn't exist in the real world.''|||[[Cobb]]}} The '''Architect''' is the designer of the [[Dream|dream space]] into which a [[dreamer]] brings a [[subject]]. An architect is similar in this regard to a video game designer, with the dream representing different levels within the game, complete with all the aesthetic and tactile details. The subject is brought into that dream space and fills it with details from their own [[projections|subconscious and memories]].
The architect does not have to design using real world architecture and physics, allowing them to create paradoxes like an [[Penrose Stairs (Dream)|endless staircase]].
When bringing a [[mark]] into the dream, a skilled architect is essential to help the dreamer make the dream feel real. Furthermore, an architect can help design mazes or other secure locations in which the mark hides his or her secrets. The mark subconsciously hides his or her secrets in a secure location, and the deeper or more important the secret, the better or more secure the location must be in order to lure the mark into populating it with their secrets.
The architect often fulfills the role of the dreamer during a heist, but the architect can also teach their designs to another to dream.
==Gallery== <gallery> architecture hotel.png|The model for the [[The Hotel (dream)|Hotel]] dream architecture city.png|The model for the [[The City (Dream)|City]] dream </gallery>
==References== <references/> [[Category:Dream Mechanics]]

[[File:inception mark.png|thumb|right|300px|[[Robert Fischer]], the mark for [[The Fischer Inception Job|Inception]]]]
A '''mark''' is the target of a con, and in a [[The Dreams|dream]] the mark acts as the [[subject]]. If someone is trying to perform [[Extraction]] or [[Inception (tactic)|Inception]] on the mark, they can enter the mind of the mark through the process of [[Dream-Sharing|dream-sharing]].
Once inside the mark's mind, a [[Dreamer|dreamer]] can create a dream space where the mark is the subject, filling the space with [[Projections|details and secrets]] from their own subconscious. An [[Extractor|extractor]] can then either steal these secrets or perform inception by planting an idea and making the mark think it is their own.
==Notable Marks== *[[Robert Fischer]] *[[Saito]] *[[Mr. Kaneda]]
==References== <references/> [[Category:Dream Mechanics]] [[Category:Stub]]

[[File:forging.png|thumb|300px|right|Forging]] {{quote|''I've had ample opportunity to observe [[Peter Browning|Browning]], adopt his physical presence, study his mannerisms, and so on and so forth. Now, in the [[The City (Dream)|first layer of the dream]], I can impersonate Browning and suggest concepts to [[Robert Fischer|Fischer]]'s conscious mind.''|||[[Eames]]}}
A '''Forger''' is a social con person, able to make others think the forger is something other than they are. A skilled forger is a master of imitating people’s mannerisms – and in the [[The Dreams|dream world]], even their very appearance.
Forgers are able to manipulate their appearance because in the dream world a sleeper's body is a [[projection]] of their mind. With enough skill, a forger can take a wide variety of appearances, unrestricted by age, sex, or mass. The act of changing appearances seems to involve a mirror.
==Gallery== <gallery> eames forges browning.png|[[Eames]] forging [[Peter Browning]] forging browning.png|Forgery of Browning forging the blonde.png|Eames forging the blonde </gallery>
==References== <references/>
[[es:Falsificador]] [[Category:Dream Mechanics]]

page.title: User blog comment:Red Dog31/The Dark Knight vs Inception/@comment-115.242.126.104-20100805154046

revision.comment: Created page with "The Dark Knight. Although Inception has an extremely interesting plot, DK beats it. DK has a proper antagonist and involves a cat and mouse game between Batman and Joker. Plus, t…"
revision.text: The Dark Knight. Although Inception has an extremely interesting plot, DK beats it. DK has a proper antagonist and involves a cat and mouse game between Batman and Joker. Plus, there are many deaths, signifying Batman's losses. Inception doesn't have these parts where the protagonist loses and the antagonist wins. DK has a better balance, the characters are defined better, and the Joker's plans are simply ingenious.

{| border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="4" style="float:right; margin:0 0 .5em 1em; width:250px; background:#fff; border-collapse:collapse; border:1px solid #FFFFFF; font-size:smaller; line-height:1.5;" |- {{#if: {{{image|}}}| !colspan="2" style="padding:0; background:#999999; color:#FFF;"{{!}}[[File:{{{image}}}|{{{imagesize}}}]] {{!}}- }} !colspan="2" style="color:#d4d4d4; background:#2f2f2f; font-size:larger;"|{{{name}}} |- {{#if: {{{level|}}}{{{dreamer|}}}| !colspan="2" style="text-align:left; font-weight:normal; background:#472656; color:#d4d4d4"{{!}}'''Dream Information''' {{!}}- }} {{#if: {{{level|}}}| {{!}}style="border-top: 1px solid #999; border-bottom: 1px solid #999; background: #000000"{{!}}Level {{!}} class="infoboxcell" style="border-top: 1px solid #999; border-bottom: 1px solid #999; background: #000000"{{!}} {{{level}}} {{!}}- }} {{#if: {{{dreamer|}}}| {{!}}style="border-top: 1px solid #999; border-bottom: 1px solid #999; background: #000000"{{!}}Dreamer {{!}} class="infoboxcell" style="border-top: 1px solid #999; border-bottom: 1px solid #999; background: #000000"{{!}} {{{dreamer}}} {{!}}- }} {{#if: {{{subject|}}}| {{!}}style="border-top: 1px solid #999; border-bottom: 1px solid #999; background: #000000"{{!}}Subject {{!}} class="infoboxcell" style="border-top: 1px solid #999; border-bottom: 1px solid #999; background: #000000"{{!}} {{{subject}}} {{!}}- }} {{#if: {{{kick|}}}| {{!}}style="border-top: 1px solid #999; border-bottom: 1px solid #999; background: #000000"{{!}}Kick(s) {{!}} class="infoboxcell" style="border-top: 1px solid #999; border-bottom: 1px solid #999; background: #000000"{{!}} {{{kick}}} {{!}}- }} {{#if: {{{sleepers|}}}| {{!}}style="border-top: 1px solid #999; border-bottom: 1px solid #999; background: #000000"{{!}}Other Sleepers {{!}} class="infoboxcell" style="border-top: 1px solid #999; border-bottom: 1px solid #999; background: #000000"{{!}} {{{sleepers}}} {{!}}- }} |} This template adds an infobox for a dream. == Usage == 
{{Infobox dream
|image=
|imagesize=
|name=
|level=
|dreamer=
|subject=
|kick=
|sleepers=
}}
All fields except ''name'' are optional. == Example == 
{{Infobox dream
|image=
|imagesize=
|name=The City
|level=xyz
|dreamer=xyz
|subject=xyz
|kick=xyz
|sleepers=xyz
}}
== Result == {{Infobox dream |image= |imagesize=250px |name=The City |level=xyz |dreamer=xyz |subject=xyz |kick=xyz |sleepers=xyz }} [[Category:Infobox templates]]

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Matias arana 10/Reviews of Inception/@comment-Skeep81-20100805230611]] to [[User blog comment:Matias Arana/Reviews of Inception/@comment-Skeep81-20100805230611]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Matia
revision.text: I just saw it

I'm unconvinced that the above-mentioned kick of blowing up the hospital is a kick to retrieve Ariadne from limbo. Didn't she bring herself out of limbo by jumping off the porch of Mal's house? I was under the impression that the only way to wake a person from limbo is to kill them, as Dom and Mal demonstrated by being run over by the train. However....Dom does tell Ariadne to check that Fischer is alive before she throws him off the bulding...I'm very unsure of the mechanics of that part of the movie, as I think many of us are.

revision.comment: Created page with "I think it's fair enough to say that perhaps Cobb's original totem was his wedding ring. He had to have used something before he started using his wife's. And maybe the appearanc…"
revision.text: I think it's fair enough to say that perhaps Cobb's original totem was his wedding ring. He had to have used something before he started using his wife's. And maybe the appearance of the wedding ring whenever he is around his wife was another nod to him falling into the trap, giving her back her own totem, giving in to her madness... which was his own anyway.

revision.text:
The one thing I don't get is how near the end, Cobb in limbo tells Mal "We did grow old together." And you have all the images of their wrinkled hands together and all that, yet, when they lay on the train tracks and killed themselves, they were young again?
I don't get that.

revision.comment: moved [[Talk:The Mountain (dream)/@comment-Andersson david1-20100806061503]] to [[Talk:Snow-Covered Mountains (dream)/@comment-Andersson david1-20100806061503]]: script
revision.text:
It's my understanding that synchronized kicks are required to wake sleepers from dreams with multiple levels.
This means that the defibrillator can only wake fischer so long as fischer experiences a synchronized kick within the dream/Limbo (the fall).
This also means that the explosives fulfill two roles:
1) when coupled with a synchronized kick from within limbo (the fall) they allow Ariadne to wake from Limbo.
2) when coupled with the kick in level 2 they allow all the sleepers to wake from level 3.

revision.comment: moved [[User blog:Samsonius/New Skin]] to [[User blog:Azaelius/New Skin]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsonius]]" to "[[User:Azaelius|Azaelius]]"
revision.text: Hey everyone, you most likely noticed a few graphical changes on the wiki. I've been messing around with creating a new skin for this wiki, mostly as a template for other wiki skins, and I just applied it at around noon (Pacific time) today. There were a lot of bugs to sort out, but with the help of a few people who actually knew what they were doing, we sorted them out (I think). If you'd like to request any changes or if you see any bugs, you can report them on [[User talk:Samsonius|my talk page]], and I will see to them as soon as I can. Thanks, and let's keep up the great work on the wiki! [[Category:Blog posts]]

revision.comment: Created page with "I'd like to make two edits to the page but want to know if anyone disputes them first: 1) A totem does not let you know if you're dreaming, it just lets you know if you're in a …"
revision.text:
I'd like to make two edits to the page but want to know if anyone disputes them first:
1) A totem does not let you know if you're dreaming, it just lets you know if you're in a dream created by someone else. That's why you never let anyone else touch your totem, because if they recreate your totem in your dream, but don't know the correct specifications then they won't be able to recreate it correctly.
2) I believe that they state in the movie that totem's aren't necessarily a universal thing, it was something that Mal came up with. Cobb gave the idea to people he worked with like Arthur and Eames and Ariadne, but others like Yusuf and Saito are never shown even acknowledging what a totem is.

revision.comment: Created page with "I love them both, but Inception is my favorite movie of the last 20 years and maybe even of all time. The Dark Knight had great actors but Inception had great acting. I admit tha…"
revision.text: I love them both, but Inception is my favorite movie of the last 20 years and maybe even of all time. The Dark Knight had great actors but Inception had great acting. I admit that for a long time I hated Leonardo, but after seeing Shutter Island and Inception, I am hoping he continues with starring in awesome movies.

revision.text: Those who say the two kids never grow up can stop now. 1. I do see the girl is taller at the end than before. But you may say it's my illusion or something. Ok, let's say my strongest proof-- 2.in the Casting list, I do saw four names for the two kids. They are Pillipa (3 year) James (20 month) Pillipa (5 year) James (2 year) This means, the director did use different actors and did mean the children grow up!! If you don't believe me, watch it again and wait for the casting list.

revision.text:
NO. THE WHOLE POINT ISN'T REALITY OR NOT.
When cobb spins the top at the end, he WALKS AWAY from the top. He doesn't check if it falls down or keeps on spinning. In a way, he no longer cares about the question of reality or dream --- he has gotten over his guilt of his wife and that's the importance of the ending.

revision.comment: Created page with "Ever since I saw the movie for the first time, I've been tossing around ideas about what my totem might be....I think I've finally decided! My totem would be an antique dip pen …"
revision.text:
Ever since I saw the movie for the first time, I've been tossing around ideas about what my totem might be....I think I've finally decided!
My totem would be an antique dip pen that writes on its own (ie, not having to use an inkwell) or write differently in a dream. This would, of course, reflect my love of writing, my affinity for things of bygone eras, and also my tendency to take my time and be a prefectionist about my work...writing with a dip pen can take hours! hahaha

'''Inception: The Big Under''' is an upcoming comic that will serve as a sequel to the first Inception comic, [[Inception: The Cobol Job|the Cobol Job]], and a prequel to [[Inception (2010 film)|the film]]. It is written by [[Jordan Goldberg]], who wrote the previous comic. It focuses on [[Saito]] and takes place right before the movie.
On August 5, 2010, the filmmakers requested artists to submit their own versions of the comic to the #inception group on deviantART.
==Plot== A Japanese punk attempts to outrace a rider in black. The punk is easily beaten as the Black Rider is greeted by a ''yakuza'', who congratulates him for his win. The Black Rider is revealed to be Saito, who frequents dreamcades to challenge other dreamers to games for money. After waking up, [[Saito]] leaves with his entourage, unaware that he is being tailed by [[Tadashi]], a Japanese teenager hired by [[Arthur]] to learn all of Saito's routines.
[[Cobb]], Arthur, and [[Nash]] prepare for their extraction of Saito. Arthur remarks that Saito is familiar with lucid dreaming, given how often he visits dreamcades. Cobb decides to use Saito's familiarity with the dreamshare to their advantage; Saito likely visits dreamcades as a means of dominance and command, so Cobb directs Arthur to construct a dream of a castle where Saito is king. When the point man protests that Nash is supposed to be their architect, Cobb reveals that the extraction will consist of two dream layers. Nash will be responsible for the dream one layer up from Arthur's, which will be a dream of a place that Saito will believe that he is conscious and awake. To this end, Cobb presents information that Saito is having an affair with Sonia, the wife of a high ranking Venezuelan government official. Cobb and Nash fly down to Venezuela to obtain the location of where Saito and Sonia have been holding their trysts.
In Venezuela, Sonia goes to a priest for a confession regarding her affair with Saito. As fog blankets the area, Sonia's purse is stolen by Nash, who passes the purse off to Cobb, as Sonia pursues him. Cobb and Nash find a gun and a digital camera containing pictures of Sonia with Saito. After dumping the contents of the purse on the ground, Cobb pretends to have found Sonia's abandoned purse when she finally catches up. When she realizes the camera is missing, Cobb blackmails her into giving him the location of her love nest with Saito. Sonia relents and gives him the information, but shoots Cobb.
Cobb wakes up from the dream; in actuality, the team had sedated Sonia when she was at a spa and extracted the information regarding Saito while she was dreaming. Having secured the location of Saito's love nest, Cobb and Nash break in so that Nash can memorize all the details of the apartment for their job and so they can set up the environment for the [[kick]] out of the dream within the dream. As Cobb warns Nash about how essential it is for Nash to have every detail right, Cobb receives a call from Arthur, who informs him that the police have approached Saito about [[Mr. Kaneda|Kaneda]]'s disappearance and Saito will likely go into hiding. This will be their best opportunity to approach Saito. Nash assures Cobb that he has memorized everything in Saito's apartment.
In Japan, Saito learns from his security that Kaneda is still missing and comments that "Kaneda-san has done his part." His security offers to escort Saito to work, but Saito refuses, insisting that he will take the train. When he boards a bullet train, Saito enters a private compartment where Tadashi is reading a comic and Nash is waiting. Behind Saito, Cobb and Arthur have arranged for the train attendant to drug Saito. While Arthur expresses concern that everything seems too easy and that they only have 30 minutes to complete the job, Cobb reminds him that [[Cobol Engineering]] will be after them.
With Saito drugged, Arthur sets up the [[PASIV Device]]. He instructs Tadashi not to let anyone enter the compartment and when there is twenty seconds left on the timer, Tadashi is to put the headphones around Nash's ears and play "Non, Je ne regrette rien". Cobb makes one last comment about how the movement of the train will have an interesting effect on the dream before Tadashi pushes the trigger on the device as the bullet train leaves the station.
==External links== *[http://inceptionmovie.warnerbros.com/deviantart/thebigunder.pdf ''Inception: The Big Under'' script] *[http://st.deviantart.net/news/inception/stills_and_script.zip ''Inception: The Big Under'', stills and script] *[http://inception.deviantart.com/ #inception group on deviantART]

revision.comment: Created page with "Saito was a military/US government deep cover spy, looking for a way to demolish the Australian energy monopoly with plausible deniability. It was shown that Saito has as much ap…"
revision.text: Saito was a military/US government deep cover spy, looking for a way to demolish the Australian energy monopoly with plausible deniability. It was shown that Saito has as much aptitude/training with dreamsharing than anyone on the team, including Dom. It was stated that the military that first developed dreamsharing for non-lethal simulation training and Saito managed to read Dom like a book during the "audition" by blanking out key pieces from the file. I was lead to believe that the engineering company that took the first architect was connected to Saito who shrugged as a seperate company. He was shot first in the levels because he was skilled threat of the group.
Sure...

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-71.245.170.96-20100808002445]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-71.245.170.96-20100808002445]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text: The children are actually different ages at the end, as two sets of actors were used as the children, one set was 3 and 20 months, the other 5 and 2, which would give at the very least 1 year and 4 months in between his wife's suicide and the ending. Also, they are wearing slightly DIFFERENT clothing than in his memories, something the costume designer and even some audience members caught. This would mean that they are different from his memory, and since his memory is all he could base his children on, it is unlikely he's in the dream world. Not to mention that at the end, the top does wobble immediately after he puts it down, going in a circle when it should remain in one spot, spinning endlessly, which would explain why he doesn't wait for it to fall to see his kids, he can already tell it's going to fall, he may just have a good spin on it and like anyone may know that if you get a good spin on a spinning top, it can keep going for a while. He instantly can tell it's reality once he sees it wobble as it never does that in the dream world, and he can tell he's not in his own dream (where, in fact, he could give the totem it's characteristics by which it is useful) once he sees his kids, as they are different than as in his memory, so for that last scene, his kids are moreso the totem as the spinning top is just Nolan giving a little wink to the audience to draw their conclusions, though with enough research, you can find out he knows what the ending is and we just had to find it.

revision.text: Also, and this is a coninuation of the above statement, when he finally confronts Mal, he tells how his projection of her was never good enough, she was just a "shade", so he obviously also wouldn't want just a projection of his aged kids, if he could come up with such a projection, as they would just be "shades" of the real thing.

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-67.60.252.209-20100808004219]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-67.60.252.209-20100808004219]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text: My opinion is this: I believe Cobb is back in reality, for a few reasons. 1) The wedding ring is gone. 2)The cast listing for James and Phillipa (the age differences). 3)James and Phillipa's clothing and shoes were, in fact different. They both had different shoes on, and Phillipa's dress was slightly different. James' hair was also longer. I think that if Cobb was still dreaming, Mal has enough knowledge about extraction, that she would give him a "kick" thus, bringing him back to reality as well, after she had "killed herself."

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-67.60.252.209-20100808005228]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-67.60.252.209-20100808005228]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text: ^^Adding onto my comment above (Anon 0:42)^^ Ariadne and Arthur went into Arthur's dream. Arthur was showing her tricks to use in her architecture such as the "Endless Staircase." This "endless staircase" was designed into the hotel staircase during the "dream within a dream" before the first kick (free fall.) Cobb was not there to witness Arthur give Ariadne the idea of the staircase, so it was NOT Cobb's dream.

revision.comment: Created page with "I'd have to argue the edits to an extent, I would think that the totems would tell the dreamer if they are dreaming because the physics in the dream worlds are usually off. Also…"
revision.text: I'd have to argue the edits to an extent, I would think that the totems would tell the dreamer if they are dreaming because the physics in the dream worlds are usually off. Also if I remember correctly, Dom and Mal created that whole world leaning towards more than one architect, and Mal's top constantly told her she was dreaming. I would have to say the second edit would be pretty valid except that perhaps Mal's father taught her about the totems.... Just some observations and personal interpretation....

revision.comment: Created page with "How would Saito's totem be his carpet?! Didn't Dom, Arthur, and that other guy in the beginning touch it?"
revision.text: How would Saito's totem be his carpet?! Didn't Dom, Arthur, and that other guy in the beginning touch it?

revision.comment: Created page with "Did Yusuf have to use the bathroom, is that why it was raining when the group entered the first level? Or is it because he drank that champagne? "
revision.text: Did Yusuf have to use the bathroom, is that why it was raining when the group entered the first level? Or is it because he drank that champagne?

revision.comment: Created page with "There was a fourth level! When Arid. and Dom go to limbo to get Fischer back from Mal, and Dom to get Saito back also. "
revision.text: There was a fourth level! When Arid. and Dom go to limbo to get Fischer back from Mal, and Dom to get Saito back also.

revision.comment: Created page with "Did you think Watanabe's accent was a little thick in some places? I couldn't understand him at some points. "
revision.text: Did you think Watanabe's accent was a little thick in some places? I couldn't understand him at some points.

revision.comment: Created page with "How about the "bombs" Arthur attaches to the ceiling in the hotel room? "
revision.text: How about the "bombs" Arthur attaches to the ceiling in the hotel room?

revision.comment: Created page with "Haha, Arthur was at odds with Eames! "Specificity"! Eames can't spell very well, no wonder he was doubtful when Arthur said that! "
revision.text: Haha, Arthur was at odds with Eames! "Specificity"! Eames can't spell very well, no wonder he was doubtful when Arthur said that!

revision.comment: Created page with "Limbo is not really a level. No one dreams it up, therefore it's not a dream level. However, it should still be included in the article."
revision.text: Limbo is not really a level. No one dreams it up, therefore it's not a dream level. However, it should still be included in the article.

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-72.88.218.179-20100808220301]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-72.88.218.179-20100808220301]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text: I think the director is really good at keeping an ambiguous ending, ambiguous. If it sparks a controversy this large, with an equal amount of supporting details on each side of the controversy, then he must have done something right. Plus there are a lot of people that are seeing it again just to see if they can find OTHER details. Making a person pay to see your movie more than once? sounds like good marketing to me.

revision.comment: Created page with "if you like them, add them! :o)"
revision.text: if you like them, add them! :o)
[[Category:Images of Dominic Cobb]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Then again, the article is more about the job as it was intended to be, as an object almost, not how it actually played out. And no one planned on going to limbo!"
revision.text: Then again, the article is more about the job as it was intended to be, as an object almost, not how it actually played out. And no one planned on going to limbo!
Miles is stated to be Dom's father-in-law, watch the movie again.

revision.comment: Created page with "How do we know his totem is the poker chip? Is there an official statement on that?"
revision.text: How do we know his totem is the poker chip? Is there an official statement on that?

revision.comment: Created page with "Yes, he needed to go to the bathroom. That is the cause for the rainstorm. He mentions that he should have gone to the bathroom before they left."
revision.text: Yes, he needed to go to the bathroom. That is the cause for the rainstorm. He mentions that he should have gone to the bathroom before they left.

revision.comment: Created page with "I feel like if Limbo is included then this article becomes more about the plot of the film than about the plan the characters make. Although, the Mr. Charles con is not in the or…"
revision.text: I feel like if Limbo is included then this article becomes more about the plot of the film than about the plan the characters make. Although, the Mr. Charles con is not in the original plan. Cobb doesn't decide to use it until Level 1 when he sees that the projections are militarized. He wants to use it in Level 2 because he believes that if it works then it will be quick, and Yusuf won't have to evade the projections for too long.

revision.comment: Created page with "Anyway, I guess what I'm saying is that I don't really mind what anyone decides, so long as it makes sense."
revision.text: Anyway, I guess what I'm saying is that I don't really mind what anyone decides, so long as it makes sense.

revision.comment: Created page with "I'm pretty sure it was a bishop. "
revision.text: I'm pretty sure it was a bishop.

revision.comment: Created page with "Just an interesting thought: Dream-sharing was invented by the military, and Eames' dream seems to have a very militaristic theme. I wonder if maybe Eames was once in the milit…"
revision.text:
Just an interesting thought:
Dream-sharing was invented by the military, and Eames' dream seems to have a very militaristic theme.
I wonder if maybe Eames was once in the military and got involved in Dream-sharing through Project Somnacin.

revision.comment: Created page with "Hmm, that's an interesting point, could be."
revision.text: Hmm, that's an interesting point, could be.

revision.comment: Created page with "Eames's dream is militaristic because the more secure the landscape of the dream, the deeper the secret the subject places in it. Furthermore, the projection are military-like be…"
revision.text: Eames's dream is militaristic because the more secure the landscape of the dream, the deeper the secret the subject places in it. Furthermore, the projection are military-like because Fischer has militarized projections and they are wearing clothing to match the landscape.

revision.comment: Created page with "Hmm, ok. But I like the military history story better :P"
revision.text: Hmm, ok. But I like the military history story better :P

revision.text: Actually, you guys. If any of you stayed for the credits, (Which I did) You would see that it lists the actors for Cobb's children when they were 5, and then the actors who portrayed them when they are their current age when Cobb returns home: 7. So they are older when he returns. Hence, he is awake.

Oh, like you did as well? Don't attack others as a replacement for defending your own position.
I don't remember which scene in the movie it was stated, though I think it was the scene where Dom first goes to Miles while he was in his class room. However, it was directly stated in the production notes.

It doesn't look like it lasted the night. That or someone reverted it.
Edit: Well it wasn't reverted, so something definitely went wrong over night.

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-77.249.132.41-20100809200818]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-77.249.132.41-20100809200818]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text:
I'm going to refute the whole ring thing. It's brilliant that you spotted it, but I think it just doesn't work that way. The ring clue would work A LOT more if Cobb HAD the ring on his finger in the last scene. Think about it. When he goes inside someone's dream he has different clothing. So... that he wears a ring now suddenly is... odd yes, but I think this is ALSO a red herring, simply due to the fact that everyone's wearing different clothing ANYWAY.
If the clue was the ring, then it would be much more logical for the last scene to have the ring, cause then it would actually have FAR more meaning to it.
The top is a red herring for two reasons, one which one of the anonymous people said. Why would people assume a top infinitely spins in a dream? It makes FAR more sense that if they spin the top in their own dream it would spin indefintely because it was their own dream. Other people who would dream would assume the top spin and then topple over, right? That is logic. So when the top is spinning infinitely it MUST be Cobb's own dream... or Mal's dream.
There are also more things why I think the whole movie is a dream. For one, nothing is explained about the technology on Dream Sharing. Well, not really a biggie, it's not all that weird, Christopher Nolan just didn't want to explain it all. But then a college graduate student called Araidne is asked to join him and she doesn't even ASK about the technology? She accepts way, WAY to quickly. Just like someone in a dream would.
Then of course the chase scene where at one point the walls seem to close in on him. I know it's also maybe a bit like it's just a narrow corridor, but like people said, if it's in the movie, it must be important, otherwise it wasn't put into the movie.
One more piece of evidence, we have no idea how Cobb got into this business, or how he got to the Japanese guy in the first place. Not knowing how you got somewhere was also a metaphor for the movie.
But I also have evidence against this.
If it's all Cobb's dream then why are there scenes without Cobb? That is a little bit weird then. One scene in particular is odd, when Ariadne asks about Cobb's ex and it's revealed that it's not an ex but that Mal is deceased. If it were Cobb's dream this would be something irrelevant for him. It's useful to us, not that I already got that at that point, but whatever, it's not useful if it was Cobb's dream.
Also, it pretty much has been established that you can't go down more than 3 levels. So if there's a level even above that, then level 3 (according to Cobb) should've been Limbo as well. Unless what the movie says about three levels can be twisted some way.
And for the "We don't know how we got there" is also a counter argument. The first scene you see is the meeting between Cobb and old Saito from inside Limbo. And after that you get an entire movie explaining how they got there. Therefore, it's not a dream.
So... which of these is more true? I think they're both equally true and equally false. Christopher Nolan put in so many clues and possibly red herrings to keep us talking. We'll probably find out so much more when it's on bluray.
For example why is the train that runs in the first level the exact same train that ran over Cobb and his wife?
Also I have another question. It's been pretty much established that the main theme to this movie is derived from a slowed down "Non, je ne regrette rien", right? Does this background theme play at ANY point in what Cobb considers the real world. If so, that should be more proof that Cobb is in a dream world, because why else would it play? Yeah, it's just backgroud music, so that proof is also a bit iffy, as is every every comment anyone here makes. Nothing is sure and I think that's the beauty of it :D I love continueing to search for these clues tho :D

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-77.249.132.41-20100809203233]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-77.249.132.41-20100809203233]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text:
I'm the anonymous above btw (20:08) and I just remembered two other things that are weird.
1. His kids call him in a hotel room somewhere, just after he spun the top. Isn't that a bit strange in itself? At least, it's strange if Cobb was on the run (which he sort of is) so wouldn't it be strange for them to know his address, much less his phone number? They do specifically call to his room, not his cell phone.
2. They are thinking how to get Fischer somewhere where he can sleep 8 hours. Saito says "a plane!" and someone else says "it has to be a boing 747" and someone else says "we have to buy the seats" and "we have to buy off the flight attendents" and then Saito says "I bought the airline". What? They were IN the process of deciding how and what and when to do it, then suddenly he already KNEW they were needing a Boeing 747. Maybe someone can explain it to me if I'm wrong, but that is a MAJOR stretch :o it's funny tho :p

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-173.16.66.190-20100809204532]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-173.16.66.190-20100809204532]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text:
I do not believe that the whole movie was in Cobb's dream because there were scenes where Cobb was not present. For example, when Ariadne goes into the dream world with Cobb's partner. But at the end I think he was in a dream, because throughout the movie he kept doing things he told people never to do, such as projecting memories and actual events. I think that's what got him in the end.
- Peter

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-24.25.214.229-20100809211612]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-24.25.214.229-20100809211612]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text: We leave the dream world, and when Cobb spins the top it keeps spinning. However, if you watch, the top begins to falter, almost like saying that Cobb meeting his children is a 'dream' come true.

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-M1st3rM1r4cl3-20100810050614]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-M1st3rM1r4cl3-20100810050614]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text:
There are things, both within the film and within the real world, that tell us Cobb was awake, alive, and well at the end of the movie. First and foremost the obvious choice, the top. Every time he spun it in the dream world or we saw it spinning within the dream it spun perfectly. Never once did it show falter of any kind. Yet within reality it would spin a few second, then falter, then fall. Now this might be refuted because Saito touched his top within Limbo. Understandable argument there. But then there were his children. We never saw their faces anytime during the movie except in the very end. Which can lead us to think two things. A)Those are his kids and he's really awake, or B)his mind has fractured and he's still dreaming and finally gave in to seeing them, subconsciously of course. But this is where the real world, our world, comes into play. On IMDB if you look up "Inception" and read the cast credits, there are two sets of children cast. Which would lead people to believe that the second set of children are indeed older, and are indeed Dom's real kids and he's truly awake. Other factors for the children are before every time Dom saw them James' hair was short blonde and he wore sandals. Phillipa's hair was slightly shorter and she wore sandals as well. Plus their clothes were a slightly different color. When Dom saw their faces in the end they both had on shoes, James' hair was longer and Phillipa was physical taller with longer hair. This in itself should be enough to say Dom is awake, but if not then I have one more argument. Dom's other totem. I call it Dom's fail safe totem. I call it this because of one reason. Arthur told Ariadne that she needed a totem to tell whether she was awake or dreaming still. Arthur proceeded to show her his loaded die. Ariadne reached for it to which Arthur pulled it back and said that no one can touch it because it would defeat the purpose. Only you must know the weight, feel, and all that jargon of what your totem does for it to work. Because if someone else does then it's useless because then you can never really know if you're asleep because someone else knows what your totem does and how it feels. The Top was Mal's totem. But since she's dead it doesn't count anymore. She has no way of influencing things other then Dom's projection of her. But if you watch the film, during the dreams Dom still has his wedding ring on. His mind is still married to Mal, which is why he wears it. But when he exits the dream world back to reality he knows she's dead and has his wedding ring off. This is one of his ways of knowing he's asleep or dreaming other then the top, and it's a visual, albeit subtle, cue to the audience to say the same thing. Now as mentioned before Saito touched the top in the end while in Limbo. Which leaves his top possibly null and void to tell whether he's asleep or not. But since Saito was in Limbo and didn't realize he was there, it probably didn't count as he thought it was just another top and not a totem. But within the final scene these three signs occur that Dom is awake. The first important one is the faltering top. The second are his kids, who have obviously aged. The third and last one, possibly most important, Dom is not wearing his wedding band. Thus showing Mal is dead.
Now that's just my theory.

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-M1st3rM1r4cl3-20100810051826]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-M1st3rM1r4cl3-20100810051826]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text: Oh and one more thing to add to everything. I've gone back and read posts and people are talking about the "unknown" people chasing Dom in Mombasa. They aren't unknown if you listen. Dom told Saito that since they failed in the extraction of his mind that the "COBOL Corporation" was going to not be happy and be on his and Arthur's ass basically. Those armed guys are from the COBOL Corporation and are after Dom and Arthur for failing on the Extraction of Saito's Mind. If you want better background on what they wanted in Saito's mind then go to the official Inception website and read the comic "The COBOL Job" is what I believe it's called. It'll make better sense then.

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-24.192.80.74-20100811043921]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-24.192.80.74-20100811043921]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsonius]...
revision.text: I vote either way because if the top falls Cobb is in reality and thats a good ending for the movie. But if there still in the dream world there could be a chance that Christopher Nolan might make a second movie where Cobb relizes they are still stuck in limbo and he has to decide if reality is better then his life in the dream. Remember: "You mustn't be afraid to dream a little bigger darling."

revision.text: My Take is at the end they are all on the plane waiting to wake up remember . Layer 1=1 week\Layer 2=6 months\Layer 3=10 years. Arthur said limbo is infinite sub-conscious.But, when he gets Saito from limbo they would not wake to the real world because of the 10- hour sedative in the real world. So the end is a paradox. But, when he walks in the house its real the girl is distinct older and a little taller.

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-186.45.25.131-20100812171235]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-186.45.25.131-20100812171235]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text: also it can't all be a dream because Arthur even says that mal is dead when he talks to Ariadne and e had no reason to lie to her.When Cobb goes to Micheal Caine he tells him to come back to reality after he says Mal won't let him dream and build any more.

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-186.45.25.131-20100812172255]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-186.45.25.131-20100812172255]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsoniu...
revision.text: Ariadne was sent to make him deal with his drama.Look at layer 3. Eames just happen to have one of the Kits so that they could go another layer deep. Ariadne Did in that scene what she did earlier on in the movie when she brought her memory in to his dream but,instead she let him put his dream into her mind forcing him to deal with Mal,and destroying his representation of limbo and freeing up his sub-concussion.

revision.comment: moved [[User blog comment:Samsonius/End Theories/@comment-82.131.32.5-20100812181915]] to [[User blog comment:Azaelius/End Theories/@comment-82.131.32.5-20100812181915]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:Samsonius|Samsonius]]"...
revision.text:
'' When Cob gets off the plane after the inception job is "done", many people in the airport are staring at him, just like projections do to a dreamer in a dream....you decide if that means anything ''
Well who the hells dream is he in then? That would create a Paradox because he can't be a stranger in his own dream now can he :/
Top falls. Oh and I read something by Anon :
''99% of the movie is a dream. Cobb is only in reality once he wakes up on the plane at the end. He was probably off on a business trip, on a plane ride home and fell asleep. His subconsious put everyone on the plane in his dream, etc. That's just my theory ''
Nah it can't be that because there's a prolouge, check the official website.
